61// Utility methods to ensure the communication between local search and the
62// search.
63
64// Returns true if a local optimum has been reached and cannot be improved.
65bool LocalOptimumReached(Search* search);
66
67// Returns true if the search accepts the delta (actually checking this by
68// calling AcceptDelta on the monitors of the search).
69bool AcceptDelta(Search* search, Assignment* delta, Assignment* deltadelta);
70
71// Notifies the search that a neighbor has been accepted by local search.
72void AcceptNeighbor(Search* search);
73void AcceptUncheckedNeighbor(Search* search);
74
75// ----- Base operator class for operators manipulating IntVars -----
76
77bool IntVarLocalSearchOperator::MakeNextNeighbor(Assignment* delta,
78 Assignment* deltadelta) {
79 CHECK(delta != nullptr);
80 VLOG(2) << DebugString() << "::MakeNextNeighbor(delta=("
81 << delta->DebugString() << "), deltadelta=("
82 << (deltadelta ? deltadelta->DebugString() : std::string("nullptr"));
83 while (true) {
84 RevertChanges(true);
85
86 if (!MakeOneNeighbor()) {
87 return false;
88 }
89
90 if (ApplyChanges(delta, deltadelta)) {
91 VLOG(2) << "Delta (" << DebugString() << ") = " << delta->DebugString();
92 return true;
93 }
94 }
95 return false;
96}
97// TODO(user): Make this a pure virtual.
98bool IntVarLocalSearchOperator::MakeOneNeighbor() { return true; }
99
100// ----- Base Large Neighborhood Search operator -----
101
102BaseLns::BaseLns(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars)
103 : IntVarLocalSearchOperator(vars) {}
104
105BaseLns::~BaseLns() {}
106
107bool BaseLns::MakeOneNeighbor() {
108 fragment_.clear();
109 if (NextFragment()) {
110 for (int candidate : fragment_) {
111 Deactivate(candidate);
112 }
113 return true;
114 }
115 return false;
116}
117
118void BaseLns::OnStart() { InitFragments(); }
119
120void BaseLns::InitFragments() {}
121
122void BaseLns::AppendToFragment(int index) {
123 if (index >= 0 && index < Size()) {
124 fragment_.push_back(index);
125 }
126}
127
128int BaseLns::FragmentSize() const { return fragment_.size(); }
129
130// ----- Simple Large Neighborhood Search operator -----
131
132// Frees number_of_variables (contiguous in vars) variables.
133
134namespace {
135class SimpleLns : public BaseLns {
136 public:
137 SimpleLns(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars, int number_of_variables)
138 : BaseLns(vars), index_(0), number_of_variables_(number_of_variables) {
139 CHECK_GT(number_of_variables_, 0);
140 }
141 ~SimpleLns() override {}
142 void InitFragments() override { index_ = 0; }
143 bool NextFragment() override;
144 std::string DebugString() const override { return "SimpleLns"; }
145
146 private:
147 int index_;
148 const int number_of_variables_;
149};
150
151bool SimpleLns::NextFragment() {
152 const int size = Size();
153 if (index_ < size) {
154 for (int i = index_; i < index_ + number_of_variables_; ++i) {
155 AppendToFragment(i % size);
156 }
157 ++index_;
158 return true;
159 }
160 return false;
161}
162
163// ----- Random Large Neighborhood Search operator -----
164
165// Frees up to number_of_variables random variables.
166
167class RandomLns : public BaseLns {
168 public:
169 RandomLns(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars, int number_of_variables,
170 int32_t seed)
171 : BaseLns(vars), rand_(seed), number_of_variables_(number_of_variables) {
172 CHECK_GT(number_of_variables_, 0);
173 CHECK_LE(number_of_variables_, Size());
174 }
175 ~RandomLns() override {}
176 bool NextFragment() override;
177
178 std::string DebugString() const override { return "RandomLns"; }
179
180 private:
181 std::mt19937 rand_;
182 const int number_of_variables_;
183};
184
185bool RandomLns::NextFragment() {
186 DCHECK_GT(Size(), 0);
187 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_variables_; ++i) {
188 AppendToFragment(absl::Uniform<int>(rand_, 0, Size()));
189 }
190 return true;
191}
192} // namespace
193
194LocalSearchOperator* Solver::MakeRandomLnsOperator(
195 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars, int number_of_variables) {
196 return MakeRandomLnsOperator(vars, number_of_variables, CpRandomSeed());
197}
198
199LocalSearchOperator* Solver::MakeRandomLnsOperator(
200 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars, int number_of_variables, int32_t seed) {
201 return RevAlloc(new RandomLns(vars, number_of_variables, seed));
202}

204// ----- Move Toward Target Local Search operator -----
205
206// A local search operator that compares the current assignment with a target
207// one, and that generates neighbors corresponding to a single variable being
208// changed from its current value to its target value.
209namespace {
210class MoveTowardTargetLS : public IntVarLocalSearchOperator {
211 public:
212 MoveTowardTargetLS(const std::vector<IntVar*>& variables,
213 const std::vector<int64_t>& target_values)
214 : IntVarLocalSearchOperator(variables),
215 target_(target_values),
216 // Initialize variable_index_ at the number of the of variables minus
217 // one, so that the first to be tried (after one increment) is the one
218 // of index 0.
219 variable_index_(Size() - 1) {
220 CHECK_EQ(target_values.size(), variables.size()) << "Illegal arguments.";
221 }
222
223 ~MoveTowardTargetLS() override {}
224
225 std::string DebugString() const override { return "MoveTowardTargetLS"; }
226
227 protected:
228 // Make a neighbor assigning one variable to its target value.
229 bool MakeOneNeighbor() override {
230 while (num_var_since_last_start_ < Size()) {
231 ++num_var_since_last_start_;
232 variable_index_ = (variable_index_ + 1) % Size();
233 const int64_t target_value = target_.at(variable_index_);
234 const int64_t current_value = OldValue(variable_index_);
235 if (current_value != target_value) {
236 SetValue(variable_index_, target_value);
237 return true;
238 }
239 }
240 return false;
241 }
242
243 private:
244 void OnStart() override {
245 // Do not change the value of variable_index_: this way, we keep going from
246 // where we last modified something. This is because we expect that most
247 // often, the variables we have just checked are less likely to be able
248 // to be changed to their target values than the ones we have not yet
249 // checked.
250 //
251 // Consider the case where oddly indexed variables can be assigned to their
252 // target values (no matter in what order they are considered), while even
253 // indexed ones cannot. Restarting at index 0 each time an odd-indexed
254 // variable is modified will cause a total of Theta(n^2) neighbors to be
255 // generated, while not restarting will produce only Theta(n) neighbors.
256 CHECK_GE(variable_index_, 0);
257 CHECK_LT(variable_index_, Size());
258 num_var_since_last_start_ = 0;
259 }
260
261 // Target values
262 const std::vector<int64_t> target_;
263
264 // Index of the next variable to try to restore
265 int64_t variable_index_;
266
267 // Number of variables checked since the last call to OnStart().
268 int64_t num_var_since_last_start_;
269};
270} // namespace
271
272LocalSearchOperator* Solver::MakeMoveTowardTargetOperator(
273 const Assignment& target) {
274 typedef std::vector<IntVarElement> Elements;
275 const Elements& elements = target.IntVarContainer().elements();
276 // Copy target values and construct the vector of variables
277 std::vector<IntVar*> vars;
278 std::vector<int64_t> values;
279 vars.reserve(target.NumIntVars());
280 values.reserve(target.NumIntVars());
281 for (const auto& it : elements) {
282 vars.push_back(it.Var());
283 values.push_back(it.Value());
284 }
285 return MakeMoveTowardTargetOperator(vars, values);
286}
287
288LocalSearchOperator* Solver::MakeMoveTowardTargetOperator(
289 const std::vector<IntVar*>& variables,
290 const std::vector<int64_t>& target_values) {
291 return RevAlloc(new MoveTowardTargetLS(variables, target_values));
292}

294// ----- ChangeValue Operators -----
295
296ChangeValue::ChangeValue(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars)
297 : IntVarLocalSearchOperator(vars), index_(0) {}
298
299ChangeValue::~ChangeValue() {}
300
301bool ChangeValue::MakeOneNeighbor() {
302 const int size = Size();
303 while (index_ < size) {
304 const int64_t value = ModifyValue(index_, Value(index_));
305 SetValue(index_, value);
306 ++index_;
307 return true;
308 }
309 return false;
310}
311
312void ChangeValue::OnStart() { index_ = 0; }
313
314// Increments the current value of variables.
315
316namespace {
317class IncrementValue : public ChangeValue {
318 public:
319 explicit IncrementValue(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars)
320 : ChangeValue(vars) {}
321 ~IncrementValue() override {}
322 int64_t ModifyValue(int64_t, int64_t value) override { return value + 1; }
323
324 std::string DebugString() const override { return "IncrementValue"; }
325};
326
327// Decrements the current value of variables.
328
329class DecrementValue : public ChangeValue {
330 public:
331 explicit DecrementValue(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars)
332 : ChangeValue(vars) {}
333 ~DecrementValue() override {}
334 int64_t ModifyValue(int64_t, int64_t value) override { return value - 1; }
335
336 std::string DebugString() const override { return "DecrementValue"; }
337};
338} // namespace

340// ----- Path-based Operators -----
341
342PathOperator::PathOperator(const std::vector<IntVar*>& next_vars,
343 const std::vector<IntVar*>& path_vars,
344 IterationParameters iteration_parameters)
345 : IntVarLocalSearchOperator(next_vars, true),
346 number_of_nexts_(next_vars.size()),
347 ignore_path_vars_(path_vars.empty()),
348 next_base_to_increment_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes),
349 base_nodes_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes),
350 base_alternatives_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes),
351 base_sibling_alternatives_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes),
352 end_nodes_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes),
353 base_paths_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes),
354 node_path_starts_(number_of_nexts_, -1),
355 node_path_ends_(number_of_nexts_, -1),
356 calls_per_base_node_(iteration_parameters.number_of_base_nodes, 0),
357 just_started_(false),
358 first_start_(true),
359 iteration_parameters_(std::move(iteration_parameters)),
360 optimal_paths_enabled_(false),
361 alternative_index_(next_vars.size(), -1) {
362 DCHECK_GT(iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes, 0);
363 if (!ignore_path_vars_) {
364 AddVars(path_vars);
365 }
366 path_basis_.push_back(0);
367 for (int i = 1; i < base_nodes_.size(); ++i) {
368 if (!OnSamePathAsPreviousBase(i)) path_basis_.push_back(i);
369 }
370 if ((path_basis_.size() > 2) ||
371 (!next_vars.empty() && !next_vars.back()
372 ->solver()
373 ->parameters()
374 .skip_locally_optimal_paths())) {
375 iteration_parameters_.skip_locally_optimal_paths = false;
376 }
377}
378
379void PathOperator::Reset() { optimal_paths_.clear(); }
380
381void PathOperator::OnStart() {
382 optimal_paths_enabled_ = false;
383 InitializeBaseNodes();
384 InitializeAlternatives();
385 OnNodeInitialization();
386}
387
388bool PathOperator::MakeOneNeighbor() {
389 while (IncrementPosition()) {
390 // Need to revert changes here since MakeNeighbor might have returned false
391 // and have done changes in the previous iteration.
392 RevertChanges(true);
393 if (MakeNeighbor()) {
394 return true;
395 }
396 }
397 return false;
398}
399
400bool PathOperator::SkipUnchanged(int index) const {
401 if (ignore_path_vars_) {
402 return true;
403 }
404 if (index < number_of_nexts_) {
405 int path_index = index + number_of_nexts_;
406 return Value(path_index) == OldValue(path_index);
407 }
408 int next_index = index - number_of_nexts_;
409 return Value(next_index) == OldValue(next_index);
410}
411
412bool PathOperator::MoveChain(int64_t before_chain, int64_t chain_end,
413 int64_t destination) {
414 if (destination == before_chain || destination == chain_end) return false;
415 DCHECK(CheckChainValidity(before_chain, chain_end, destination) &&
416 !IsPathEnd(chain_end) && !IsPathEnd(destination));
417 const int64_t destination_path = Path(destination);
418 const int64_t after_chain = Next(chain_end);
419 SetNext(chain_end, Next(destination), destination_path);
420 if (!ignore_path_vars_) {
421 int current = destination;
422 int next = Next(before_chain);
423 while (current != chain_end) {
424 SetNext(current, next, destination_path);
425 current = next;
426 next = Next(next);
427 }
428 } else {
429 SetNext(destination, Next(before_chain), destination_path);
430 }
431 SetNext(before_chain, after_chain, Path(before_chain));
432 return true;
433}
434
435bool PathOperator::ReverseChain(int64_t before_chain, int64_t after_chain,
436 int64_t* chain_last) {
437 if (CheckChainValidity(before_chain, after_chain, -1)) {
438 int64_t path = Path(before_chain);
439 int64_t current = Next(before_chain);
440 if (current == after_chain) {
441 return false;
442 }
443 int64_t current_next = Next(current);
444 SetNext(current, after_chain, path);
445 while (current_next != after_chain) {
446 const int64_t next = Next(current_next);
447 SetNext(current_next, current, path);
448 current = current_next;
449 current_next = next;
450 }
451 SetNext(before_chain, current, path);
452 *chain_last = current;
453 return true;
454 }
455 return false;
456}
457
458bool PathOperator::MakeActive(int64_t node, int64_t destination) {
459 if (!IsPathEnd(destination)) {
460 int64_t destination_path = Path(destination);
461 SetNext(node, Next(destination), destination_path);
462 SetNext(destination, node, destination_path);
463 return true;
464 }
465 return false;
466}
467
468bool PathOperator::MakeChainInactive(int64_t before_chain, int64_t chain_end) {
469 const int64_t kNoPath = -1;
470 if (CheckChainValidity(before_chain, chain_end, -1) &&
471 !IsPathEnd(chain_end)) {
472 const int64_t after_chain = Next(chain_end);
473 int64_t current = Next(before_chain);
474 while (current != after_chain) {
475 const int64_t next = Next(current);
476 SetNext(current, current, kNoPath);
477 current = next;
478 }
479 SetNext(before_chain, after_chain, Path(before_chain));
480 return true;
481 }
482 return false;
483}
484
485bool PathOperator::SwapActiveAndInactive(int64_t active, int64_t inactive) {
486 if (active == inactive) return false;
487 const int64_t prev = Prev(active);
488 return MakeChainInactive(prev, active) && MakeActive(inactive, prev);
489}
490
491bool PathOperator::IncrementPosition() {
492 const int base_node_size = iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes;
493
494 if (!just_started_) {
495 const int number_of_paths = path_starts_.size();
496 // Finding next base node positions.
497 // Increment the position of inner base nodes first (higher index nodes);
498 // if a base node is at the end of a path, reposition it at the start
499 // of the path and increment the position of the preceding base node (this
500 // action is called a restart).
501 int last_restarted = base_node_size;
502 for (int i = base_node_size - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
503 if (base_nodes_[i] < number_of_nexts_ && i <= next_base_to_increment_) {
504 if (ConsiderAlternatives(i)) {
505 // Iterate on sibling alternatives.
506 const int sibling_alternative_index =
507 GetSiblingAlternativeIndex(base_nodes_[i]);
508 if (sibling_alternative_index >= 0) {
509 if (base_sibling_alternatives_[i] <
510 alternative_sets_[sibling_alternative_index].size() - 1) {
511 ++base_sibling_alternatives_[i];
512 break;
513 }
514 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
515 }
516 // Iterate on base alternatives.
517 const int alternative_index = alternative_index_[base_nodes_[i]];
518 if (alternative_index >= 0) {
519 if (base_alternatives_[i] <
520 alternative_sets_[alternative_index].size() - 1) {
521 ++base_alternatives_[i];
522 break;
523 }
524 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
525 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
526 }
527 }
528 if (iteration_parameters_.get_neighbors != nullptr &&
529 ++calls_per_base_node_[i] <
530 iteration_parameters_.get_neighbors(BaseNode(i), StartNode(i))
531 .size()) {
532 break;
533 }
534 calls_per_base_node_[i] = 0;
535 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
536 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
537 base_nodes_[i] = OldNext(base_nodes_[i]);
538 if (iteration_parameters_.accept_path_end_base ||
539 !IsPathEnd(base_nodes_[i]))
540 break;
541 }
542 calls_per_base_node_[i] = 0;
543 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
544 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
545 base_nodes_[i] = StartNode(i);
546 last_restarted = i;
547 }
548 next_base_to_increment_ = base_node_size;
549 // At the end of the loop, base nodes with indexes in
550 // [last_restarted, base_node_size[ have been restarted.
551 // Restarted base nodes are then repositioned by the virtual
552 // GetBaseNodeRestartPosition to reflect position constraints between
553 // base nodes (by default GetBaseNodeRestartPosition leaves the nodes
554 // at the start of the path).
555 // Base nodes are repositioned in ascending order to ensure that all
556 // base nodes "below" the node being repositioned have their final
557 // position.
558 for (int i = last_restarted; i < base_node_size; ++i) {
559 calls_per_base_node_[i] = 0;
560 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
561 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
562 base_nodes_[i] = GetBaseNodeRestartPosition(i);
563 }
564 if (last_restarted > 0) {
565 return CheckEnds();
566 }
567 // If all base nodes have been restarted, base nodes are moved to new paths.
568 // First we mark the current paths as locally optimal if they have been
569 // completely explored.
570 if (optimal_paths_enabled_ &&
571 iteration_parameters_.skip_locally_optimal_paths) {
572 if (path_basis_.size() > 1) {
573 for (int i = 1; i < path_basis_.size(); ++i) {
574 optimal_paths_[num_paths_ *
575 start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[i - 1])] +
576 start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[i])]] = true;
577 }
578 } else {
579 optimal_paths_[num_paths_ * start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[0])] +
580 start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[0])]] = true;
581 }
582 }
583 std::vector<int> current_starts(base_node_size);
584 for (int i = 0; i < base_node_size; ++i) {
585 current_starts[i] = StartNode(i);
586 }
587 // Exploration of next paths can lead to locally optimal paths since we are
588 // exploring them from scratch.
589 optimal_paths_enabled_ = true;
590 while (true) {
591 for (int i = base_node_size - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
592 const int next_path_index = base_paths_[i] + 1;
593 if (next_path_index < number_of_paths) {
594 base_paths_[i] = next_path_index;
595 calls_per_base_node_[i] = 0;
596 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
597 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
598 base_nodes_[i] = path_starts_[next_path_index];
599 if (i == 0 || !OnSamePathAsPreviousBase(i)) {
600 break;
601 }
602 } else {
603 base_paths_[i] = 0;
604 calls_per_base_node_[i] = 0;
605 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
606 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
607 base_nodes_[i] = path_starts_[0];
608 }
609 }
610 if (!iteration_parameters_.skip_locally_optimal_paths) return CheckEnds();
611 // If the new paths have already been completely explored, we can
612 // skip them from now on.
613 if (path_basis_.size() > 1) {
614 for (int j = 1; j < path_basis_.size(); ++j) {
615 if (!optimal_paths_[num_paths_ * start_to_path_[StartNode(
616 path_basis_[j - 1])] +
617 start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[j])]]) {
618 return CheckEnds();
619 }
620 }
621 } else {
622 if (!optimal_paths_[num_paths_ *
623 start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[0])] +
624 start_to_path_[StartNode(path_basis_[0])]]) {
625 return CheckEnds();
626 }
627 }
628 // If we are back to paths we just iterated on or have reached the end
629 // of the neighborhood search space, we can stop.
630 if (!CheckEnds()) return false;
631 bool stop = true;
632 for (int i = 0; i < base_node_size; ++i) {
633 if (StartNode(i) != current_starts[i]) {
634 stop = false;
635 break;
636 }
637 }
638 if (stop) return false;
639 }
640 } else {
641 just_started_ = false;
642 return true;
643 }
644 return CheckEnds();
645}
646
647void PathOperator::InitializePathStarts() {
648 // Detect nodes which do not have any possible predecessor in a path; these
649 // nodes are path starts.
650 int max_next = -1;
651 std::vector<bool> has_prevs(number_of_nexts_, false);
652 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_nexts_; ++i) {
653 const int next = OldNext(i);
654 if (next < number_of_nexts_) {
655 has_prevs[next] = true;
656 }
657 max_next = std::max(max_next, next);
658 }
659 // Update locally optimal paths.
660 if (optimal_paths_.empty() &&
661 iteration_parameters_.skip_locally_optimal_paths) {
662 num_paths_ = 0;
663 start_to_path_.clear();
664 start_to_path_.resize(number_of_nexts_, -1);
665 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_nexts_; ++i) {
666 if (!has_prevs[i]) {
667 start_to_path_[i] = num_paths_;
668 ++num_paths_;
669 }
670 }
671 optimal_paths_.resize(num_paths_ * num_paths_, false);
672 }
673 if (iteration_parameters_.skip_locally_optimal_paths) {
674 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_nexts_; ++i) {
675 if (!has_prevs[i]) {
676 int current = i;
677 while (!IsPathEnd(current)) {
678 if ((OldNext(current) != PrevNext(current))) {
679 for (int j = 0; j < num_paths_; ++j) {
680 optimal_paths_[num_paths_ * start_to_path_[i] + j] = false;
681 optimal_paths_[num_paths_ * j + start_to_path_[i]] = false;
682 }
683 break;
684 }
685 current = OldNext(current);
686 }
687 }
688 }
689 }
690 // Create a list of path starts, dropping equivalent path starts of
691 // currently empty paths.
692 std::vector<bool> empty_found(number_of_nexts_, false);
693 std::vector<int64_t> new_path_starts;
694 const bool use_empty_path_symmetry_breaker =
695 absl::GetFlag(FLAGS_cp_use_empty_path_symmetry_breaker);
696 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_nexts_; ++i) {
697 if (!has_prevs[i]) {
698 if (use_empty_path_symmetry_breaker && IsPathEnd(OldNext(i))) {
699 if (iteration_parameters_.start_empty_path_class != nullptr) {
700 if (empty_found[iteration_parameters_.start_empty_path_class(i)])
701 continue;
702 empty_found[iteration_parameters_.start_empty_path_class(i)] = true;
703 }
704 }
705 new_path_starts.push_back(i);
706 }
707 }
708 if (!first_start_) {
709 // Synchronizing base_paths_ with base node positions. When the last move
710 // was performed a base node could have been moved to a new route in which
711 // case base_paths_ needs to be updated. This needs to be done on the path
712 // starts before we re-adjust base nodes for new path starts.
713 std::vector<int> node_paths(max_next + 1, -1);
714 for (int i = 0; i < path_starts_.size(); ++i) {
715 int node = path_starts_[i];
716 while (!IsPathEnd(node)) {
717 node_paths[node] = i;
718 node = OldNext(node);
719 }
720 node_paths[node] = i;
721 }
722 for (int j = 0; j < iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes; ++j) {
723 // Always restart from first alternative.
724 calls_per_base_node_[j] = 0;
725 base_alternatives_[j] = 0;
726 base_sibling_alternatives_[j] = 0;
727 if (IsInactive(base_nodes_[j]) || node_paths[base_nodes_[j]] == -1) {
728 // Base node was made inactive or was moved to a new path, reposition
729 // the base node to the start of the path on which it was.
730 base_nodes_[j] = path_starts_[base_paths_[j]];
731 } else {
732 base_paths_[j] = node_paths[base_nodes_[j]];
733 }
734 }
735 // Re-adjust current base_nodes and base_paths to take into account new
736 // path starts (there could be fewer if a new path was made empty, or more
737 // if nodes were added to a formerly empty path).
738 int new_index = 0;
739 absl::flat_hash_set<int> found_bases;
740 for (int i = 0; i < path_starts_.size(); ++i) {
741 int index = new_index;
742 // Note: old and new path starts are sorted by construction.
743 while (index < new_path_starts.size() &&
744 new_path_starts[index] < path_starts_[i]) {
745 ++index;
746 }
747 const bool found = (index < new_path_starts.size() &&
748 new_path_starts[index] == path_starts_[i]);
749 if (found) {
750 new_index = index;
751 }
752 for (int j = 0; j < iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes; ++j) {
753 if (base_paths_[j] == i && !found_bases.contains(j)) {
754 found_bases.insert(j);
755 base_paths_[j] = new_index;
756 // If the current position of the base node is a removed empty path,
757 // readjusting it to the last visited path start.
758 if (!found) {
759 base_nodes_[j] = new_path_starts[new_index];
760 }
761 }
762 }
763 }
764 }
765 path_starts_.swap(new_path_starts);
766 // For every base path, store the end corresponding to the path start.
767 // TODO(user): make this faster, maybe by pairing starts with ends.
768 path_ends_.clear();
769 path_ends_.reserve(path_starts_.size());
770 int64_t max_node_index = number_of_nexts_ - 1;
771 for (const int start_node : path_starts_) {
772 int64_t node = start_node;
773 while (!IsPathEnd(node)) node = OldNext(node);
774 path_ends_.push_back(node);
775 max_node_index = std::max(max_node_index, node);
776 }
777 node_path_starts_.assign(max_node_index + 1, -1);
778 node_path_ends_.assign(max_node_index + 1, -1);
779 for (int i = 0; i < path_starts_.size(); ++i) {
780 const int64_t start_node = path_starts_[i];
781 const int64_t end_node = path_ends_[i];
782 int64_t node = start_node;
783 while (!IsPathEnd(node)) {
784 node_path_starts_[node] = start_node;
785 node_path_ends_[node] = end_node;
786 node = OldNext(node);
787 }
788 node_path_starts_[node] = start_node;
789 node_path_ends_[node] = end_node;
790 }
791}
792
793void PathOperator::InitializeInactives() {
794 inactives_.clear();
795 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_nexts_; ++i) {
796 inactives_.push_back(OldNext(i) == i);
797 }
798}
799
800void PathOperator::InitializeBaseNodes() {
801 // Inactive nodes must be detected before determining new path starts.
802 InitializeInactives();
803 InitializePathStarts();
804 if (first_start_ || InitPosition()) {
805 // Only do this once since the following starts will continue from the
806 // preceding position
807 for (int i = 0; i < iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes; ++i) {
808 base_paths_[i] = 0;
809 base_nodes_[i] = path_starts_[0];
810 }
811 first_start_ = false;
812 }
813 for (int i = 0; i < iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes; ++i) {
814 // If base node has been made inactive, restart from path start.
815 int64_t base_node = base_nodes_[i];
816 if (RestartAtPathStartOnSynchronize() || IsInactive(base_node)) {
817 base_node = path_starts_[base_paths_[i]];
818 base_nodes_[i] = base_node;
819 }
820 end_nodes_[i] = base_node;
821 }
822 // Repair end_nodes_ in case some must be on the same path and are not anymore
823 // (due to other operators moving these nodes).
824 for (int i = 1; i < iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes; ++i) {
825 if (OnSamePathAsPreviousBase(i) &&
826 !OnSamePath(base_nodes_[i - 1], base_nodes_[i])) {
827 const int64_t base_node = base_nodes_[i - 1];
828 base_nodes_[i] = base_node;
829 end_nodes_[i] = base_node;
830 base_paths_[i] = base_paths_[i - 1];
831 }
832 }
833 for (int i = 0; i < iteration_parameters_.number_of_base_nodes; ++i) {
834 base_alternatives_[i] = 0;
835 base_sibling_alternatives_[i] = 0;
836 calls_per_base_node_[i] = 0;
837 }
838 just_started_ = true;
839}
840
841void PathOperator::InitializeAlternatives() {
842 active_in_alternative_set_.resize(alternative_sets_.size(), -1);
843 for (int i = 0; i < alternative_sets_.size(); ++i) {
844 const int64_t current_active = active_in_alternative_set_[i];
845 if (current_active >= 0 && !IsInactive(current_active)) continue;
846 for (int64_t index : alternative_sets_[i]) {
847 if (!IsInactive(index)) {
848 active_in_alternative_set_[i] = index;
849 break;
850 }
851 }
852 }
853}
854
855bool PathOperator::OnSamePath(int64_t node1, int64_t node2) const {
856 if (IsInactive(node1) != IsInactive(node2)) {
857 return false;
858 }
859 for (int node = node1; !IsPathEnd(node); node = OldNext(node)) {
860 if (node == node2) {
861 return true;
862 }
863 }
864 for (int node = node2; !IsPathEnd(node); node = OldNext(node)) {
865 if (node == node1) {
866 return true;
867 }
868 }
869 return false;
870}
871
872// Rejects chain if chain_end is not after before_chain on the path or if
873// the chain contains exclude. Given before_chain is the node before the
874// chain, if before_chain and chain_end are the same the chain is rejected too.
875// Also rejects cycles (cycle detection is detected through chain length
876// overflow).
877bool PathOperator::CheckChainValidity(int64_t before_chain, int64_t chain_end,
878 int64_t exclude) const {
879 if (before_chain == chain_end || before_chain == exclude) return false;
880 int64_t current = before_chain;
881 int chain_size = 0;
882 while (current != chain_end) {
883 if (chain_size > number_of_nexts_) {
884 return false;
885 }
886 if (IsPathEnd(current)) {
887 return false;
888 }
889 current = Next(current);
890 ++chain_size;
891 if (current == exclude) {
892 return false;
893 }
894 }
895 return true;
896}
897
898// ----- 2Opt -----
899
900// Reverses a sub-chain of a path. It is called 2Opt because it breaks
901// 2 arcs on the path; resulting paths are called 2-optimal.
902// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5
903// (where (1, 5) are first and last nodes of the path and can therefore not be
904// moved):
905// 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5
906// 1 -> 4 -> 3 -> 2 -> 5
907// 1 -> 2 -> 4 -> 3 -> 5
908class TwoOpt : public PathOperator {
909 public:
910 TwoOpt(
911 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
912 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
913 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
914 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors = nullptr)
915 : PathOperator(
916 vars, secondary_vars, get_neighbors == nullptr ? 2 : 1,
917 /*skip_locally_optimal_paths=*/true, /*accept_path_end_base=*/true,
918 std::move(start_empty_path_class), std::move(get_neighbors)),
919 last_base_(-1),
920 last_(-1) {}
921 ~TwoOpt() override {}
922 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
923 bool IsIncremental() const override { return true; }
924
925 std::string DebugString() const override { return "TwoOpt"; }
926
927 protected:
928 bool OnSamePathAsPreviousBase(int64_t /*base_index*/) override {
929 // Both base nodes have to be on the same path.
930 return true;
931 }
932 int64_t GetBaseNodeRestartPosition(int base_index) override {
933 return (base_index == 0) ? StartNode(0) : BaseNode(0);
934 }
935
936 private:
937 void OnNodeInitialization() override { last_ = -1; }
938
939 int64_t last_base_;
940 int64_t last_;
941};
942
943bool TwoOpt::MakeNeighbor() {
944 const int64_t node0 = BaseNode(0);
945 int64_t node1 = -1;
946 if (HasNeighbors()) {
947 const int64_t neighbor = GetNeighborForBaseNode(0);
948 if (IsInactive(neighbor)) return false;
949 if (CurrentNodePathStart(node0) != CurrentNodePathStart(neighbor)) {
950 return false;
951 }
952 node1 = Next(neighbor);
953 } else {
954 DCHECK_EQ(StartNode(0), StartNode(1));
955 node1 = BaseNode(1);
956 }
957 // Incrementality is disabled with neighbors.
958 if (last_base_ != node0 || last_ == -1 || HasNeighbors()) {
959 RevertChanges(false);
960 if (IsPathEnd(node0)) {
961 last_ = -1;
962 return false;
963 }
964 last_base_ = node0;
965 last_ = Next(node0);
966 int64_t chain_last;
967 if (ReverseChain(node0, node1, &chain_last)
968 // Check there are more than one node in the chain (reversing a
969 // single node is a NOP).
970 && last_ != chain_last) {
971 return true;
972 }
973 last_ = -1;
974 return false;
975 }
976 const int64_t to_move = Next(last_);
977 DCHECK_EQ(Next(to_move), node1);
978 return MoveChain(last_, to_move, node0);
979}
980
981// ----- Relocate -----
982
983// Moves a sub-chain of a path to another position; the specified chain length
984// is the fixed length of the chains being moved. When this length is 1 the
985// operator simply moves a node to another position.
986// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5, for a chain length
987// of 2 (where (1, 5) are first and last nodes of the path and can
988// therefore not be moved):
989// 1 -> 4 -> 2 -> 3 -> 5
990// 1 -> 3 -> 4 -> 2 -> 5
991//
992// Using Relocate with chain lengths of 1, 2 and 3 together is equivalent to
993// the OrOpt operator on a path. The OrOpt operator is a limited version of
994// 3Opt (breaks 3 arcs on a path).
995
996class Relocate : public PathOperator {
997 public:
998 Relocate(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
999 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars, const std::string& name,
1000 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1001 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors,
1002 int64_t chain_length = 1LL, bool single_path = false)
1003 : PathOperator(
1004 vars, secondary_vars, get_neighbors == nullptr ? 2 : 1,
1005 /*skip_locally_optimal_paths=*/true, /*accept_path_end_base=*/false,
1006 std::move(start_empty_path_class), std::move(get_neighbors)),
1007 chain_length_(chain_length),
1008 single_path_(single_path),
1009 name_(name) {
1010 CHECK_GT(chain_length_, 0);
1011 }
1012 Relocate(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1013 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1014 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1015 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors,
1016 int64_t chain_length = 1LL, bool single_path = false)
1017 : Relocate(vars, secondary_vars,
1018 absl::StrCat("Relocate<", chain_length, ">"),
1019 std::move(start_empty_path_class), std::move(get_neighbors),
1020 chain_length, single_path) {}
1021 Relocate(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1022 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1023 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1024 int64_t chain_length = 1LL, bool single_path = false)
1025 : Relocate(vars, secondary_vars,
1026 absl::StrCat("Relocate<", chain_length, ">"),
1027 std::move(start_empty_path_class), nullptr, chain_length,
1028 single_path) {}
1029 ~Relocate() override {}
1030 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1031
1032 std::string DebugString() const override { return name_; }
1033
1034 protected:
1035 bool OnSamePathAsPreviousBase(int64_t /*base_index*/) override {
1036 // Both base nodes have to be on the same path when it's the single path
1037 // version.
1038 return single_path_;
1039 }
1040
1041 private:
1042 const int64_t chain_length_;
1043 const bool single_path_;
1044 const std::string name_;
1045};
1046
1047bool Relocate::MakeNeighbor() {
1048 const auto do_move = [this](int64_t before_chain, int64_t destination) {
1049 DCHECK(!IsPathEnd(destination));
1050 int64_t chain_end = before_chain;
1051 for (int i = 0; i < chain_length_; ++i) {
1052 if (IsPathEnd(chain_end) || chain_end == destination) return false;
1053 chain_end = Next(chain_end);
1054 }
1055 return !IsPathEnd(chain_end) &&
1056 MoveChain(before_chain, chain_end, destination);
1057 };
1058 if (HasNeighbors()) {
1059 const int64_t node = GetNeighborForBaseNode(0);
1060 if (IsInactive(node)) return false;
1061 return do_move(/*before_chain=*/Prev(node),
1062 /*destination=*/BaseNode(0));
1063 }
1064 DCHECK(!single_path_ || StartNode(0) == StartNode(1));
1065 return do_move(/*before_chain=*/BaseNode(0), /*destination=*/BaseNode(1));
1066}
1067
1068// ----- Exchange -----
1069
1070// Exchanges the positions of two nodes.
1071// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5
1072// (where (1, 5) are first and last nodes of the path and can therefore not
1073// be moved):
1074// 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5
1075// 1 -> 4 -> 3 -> 2 -> 5
1076// 1 -> 2 -> 4 -> 3 -> 5
1077
1078class Exchange : public PathOperator {
1079 public:
1080 Exchange(
1081 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1082 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1083 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1084 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors = nullptr)
1085 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, get_neighbors == nullptr ? 2 : 1,
1086 /*skip_locally_optimal_paths=*/true,
1087 /*accept_path_end_base=*/false,
1088 std::move(start_empty_path_class), get_neighbors) {}
1089 ~Exchange() override {}
1090 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1091
1092 std::string DebugString() const override { return "Exchange"; }
1093};
1094
1095bool Exchange::MakeNeighbor() {
1096 const auto do_move = [this](int64_t node1, int64_t node2) {
1097 if (IsPathEnd(node1) || IsPathEnd(node2)) return false;
1098 if (node1 == node2) return false;
1099 const int64_t prev_node1 = Prev(node1);
1100 const bool ok = MoveChain(prev_node1, node1, Prev(node2));
1101 return MoveChain(Prev(node2), node2, prev_node1) || ok;
1102 };
1103 if (HasNeighbors()) {
1104 const int64_t node = GetNeighborForBaseNode(0);
1105 if (IsInactive(node)) return false;
1106 DCHECK(!IsPathStart(node));
1107 return do_move(Next(BaseNode(0)), node);
1108 }
1109 return do_move(Next(BaseNode(0)), Next(BaseNode(1)));
1110}
1111
1112// ----- Cross -----
1113
1114// Cross echanges the starting chains of 2 paths, including exchanging the
1115// whole paths.
1116// First and last nodes are not moved.
1117// Possible neighbors for the paths 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 and 6 -> 7 -> 8
1118// (where (1, 5) and (6, 8) are first and last nodes of the paths and can
1119// therefore not be moved):
1120// 1 -> 7 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 6 -> 2 -> 8
1121// 1 -> 7 -> 4 -> 5 6 -> 2 -> 3 -> 8
1122// 1 -> 7 -> 5 6 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 8
1123
1124class Cross : public PathOperator {
1125 public:
1126 Cross(
1127 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1128 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1129 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1130 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors = nullptr)
1131 : PathOperator(
1132 vars, secondary_vars, get_neighbors == nullptr ? 2 : 1,
1133 /*skip_locally_optimal_paths=*/true, /*accept_path_end_base=*/true,
1134 std::move(start_empty_path_class), std::move(get_neighbors)) {}
1135 ~Cross() override {}
1136 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1137
1138 std::string DebugString() const override { return "Cross"; }
1139};
1140
1141bool Cross::MakeNeighbor() {
1142 const int64_t start0 = StartNode(0);
1143 int64_t start1 = -1;
1144 const int64_t node0 = BaseNode(0);
1145 int64_t node1 = -1;
1146 if (node0 == start0) return false;
1147 if (HasNeighbors()) {
1148 const int64_t neighbor = GetNeighborForBaseNode(0);
1149 DCHECK(!IsPathStart(neighbor));
1150 if (IsInactive(neighbor)) return false;
1151 start1 = CurrentNodePathStart(neighbor);
1152 // Tricky: In all cases we want to connect node0 to neighbor. If we are
1153 // crossing path starts, node0 is the end of a chain and neighbor is the
1154 // the first node after the other chain ending at node1, therefore
1155 // node1 = prev(neighbor).
1156 // If we are crossing path ends, node0 is the start of a chain and neighbor
1157 // is the last node before the other chain starting at node1, therefore
1158 // node1 = next(neighbor).
1159 // TODO(user): When neighbors are considered, explore if having two
1160 // versions of Cross makes sense, one exchanging path starts, the other
1161 // path ends. Rationale: neighborhoods might not be symmetric. In practice,
1162 // in particular when used through RoutingModel, neighborhoods are
1163 // actually symmetric.
1164 node1 = (start0 < start1) ? Prev(neighbor) : Next(neighbor);
1165 } else {
1166 start1 = StartNode(1);
1167 node1 = BaseNode(1);
1168 }
1169 if (start1 == start0 || node1 == start1) return false;
1170
1171 bool moved = false;
1172 if (start0 < start1) {
1173 // Cross path starts.
1174 // If two paths are equivalent don't exchange the full paths.
1175 if (PathClassFromStartNode(start0) == PathClassFromStartNode(start1) &&
1176 !IsPathEnd(node0) && IsPathEnd(Next(node0)) && !IsPathEnd(node1) &&
1177 IsPathEnd(Next(node1))) {
1178 return false;
1179 }
1180
1181 const int first1 = Next(start1);
1182 if (!IsPathEnd(node0)) moved |= MoveChain(start0, node0, start1);
1183 if (!IsPathEnd(node1)) moved |= MoveChain(Prev(first1), node1, start0);
1184 } else { // start1 > start0.
1185 // Cross path ends.
1186 // If paths are equivalent, every end crossing has a corresponding start
1187 // crossing, we don't generate those symmetric neighbors.
1188 if (PathClassFromStartNode(start0) == PathClassFromStartNode(start1) &&
1189 !HasNeighbors()) {
1190 return false;
1191 }
1192 // Never exchange full paths, equivalent or not.
1193 // Full path exchange is only performed when start0 < start1.
1194 if (IsPathStart(Prev(node0)) && IsPathStart(Prev(node1)) &&
1195 !HasNeighbors()) {
1196 return false;
1197 }
1198
1199 const int prev_end_node1 = Prev(CurrentNodePathEnd(node1));
1200 if (!IsPathEnd(node0)) {
1201 moved |= MoveChain(Prev(node0), Prev(EndNode(0)), prev_end_node1);
1202 }
1203 if (!IsPathEnd(node1)) {
1204 moved |= MoveChain(Prev(node1), prev_end_node1, Prev(EndNode(0)));
1205 }
1206 }
1207 return moved;
1208}
1209
1210// ----- BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator -----
1211// Base class of path operators which make inactive nodes active.
1212
1213class BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator : public PathOperator {
1214 public:
1215 BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator(
1216 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1217 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars, int number_of_base_nodes,
1218 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1219 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors = nullptr)
1220 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, number_of_base_nodes, false, false,
1221 std::move(start_empty_path_class),
1222 std::move(get_neighbors)),
1223 inactive_node_(0) {
1224 // TODO(user): Activate skipping optimal paths.
1225 }
1226 ~BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator() override {}
1227
1228 protected:
1229 bool MakeOneNeighbor() override;
1230 int64_t GetInactiveNode() const { return inactive_node_; }
1231
1232 private:
1233 void OnNodeInitialization() override;
1234
1235 int inactive_node_;
1236};
1237
1238void BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator::OnNodeInitialization() {
1239 for (int i = 0; i < Size(); ++i) {
1240 if (IsInactive(i)) {
1241 inactive_node_ = i;
1242 return;
1243 }
1244 }
1245 inactive_node_ = Size();
1246}
1247
1248bool BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator::MakeOneNeighbor() {
1249 while (inactive_node_ < Size()) {
1250 if (!IsInactive(inactive_node_) || !PathOperator::MakeOneNeighbor()) {
1251 ResetPosition();
1252 ++inactive_node_;
1253 } else {
1254 return true;
1255 }
1256 }
1257 return false;
1258}

1260// ----- MakeActiveOperator -----
1261
1262// MakeActiveOperator inserts an inactive node into a path.
1263// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 with 5 inactive (where 1 and
1264// 4 are first and last nodes of the path) are:
1265// 1 -> 5 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4
1266// 1 -> 2 -> 5 -> 3 -> 4
1267// 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 5 -> 4
1268
1269class MakeActiveOperator : public BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator {
1270 public:
1271 MakeActiveOperator(
1272 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1273 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1274 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class,
1275 std::function<const std::vector<int>&(int, int)> get_neighbors = nullptr)
1276 : BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 1,
1277 std::move(start_empty_path_class),
1278 std::move(get_neighbors)) {}
1279 ~MakeActiveOperator() override {}
1280 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1281
1282 std::string DebugString() const override { return "MakeActiveOperator"; }
1283};
1284
1285bool MakeActiveOperator::MakeNeighbor() {
1286 // TODO(user): Add support for neighbors of inactive nodes; would require
1287 // having a version without base nodes (probably not a PathOperator).
1288 return MakeActive(GetInactiveNode(), BaseNode(0));
1289}

1291// ---- RelocateAndMakeActiveOperator -----
1292
1293// RelocateAndMakeActiveOperator relocates a node and replaces it by an inactive
1294// node.
1295// The idea is to make room for inactive nodes.
1296// Possible neighbor for paths 0 -> 4, 1 -> 2 -> 5 and 3 inactive is:
1297// 0 -> 2 -> 4, 1 -> 3 -> 5.
1298// TODO(user): Naming is close to MakeActiveAndRelocate but this one is
1299// correct; rename MakeActiveAndRelocate if it is actually used.
1300class RelocateAndMakeActiveOperator : public BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator {
1301 public:
1302 RelocateAndMakeActiveOperator(
1303 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1304 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1305 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class)
1306 : BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 2,
1307 std::move(start_empty_path_class)) {}
1308 ~RelocateAndMakeActiveOperator() override {}
1309 bool MakeNeighbor() override {
1310 const int64_t before_node_to_move = BaseNode(1);
1311 const int64_t node = Next(before_node_to_move);
1312 return !IsPathEnd(node) &&
1313 MoveChain(before_node_to_move, node, BaseNode(0)) &&
1314 MakeActive(GetInactiveNode(), before_node_to_move);
1315 }
1316
1317 std::string DebugString() const override {
1318 return "RelocateAndMakeActiveOpertor";
1319 }
1320};
1321
1322// ----- MakeActiveAndRelocate -----
1323
1324// MakeActiveAndRelocate makes a node active next to a node being relocated.
1325// Possible neighbor for paths 0 -> 4, 1 -> 2 -> 5 and 3 inactive is:
1326// 0 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4, 1 -> 5.
1327
1328class MakeActiveAndRelocate : public BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator {
1329 public:
1330 MakeActiveAndRelocate(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1331 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1332 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class)
1333 : BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 2,
1334 std::move(start_empty_path_class)) {}
1335 ~MakeActiveAndRelocate() override {}
1336 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1337
1338 std::string DebugString() const override {
1339 return "MakeActiveAndRelocateOperator";
1340 }
1341};
1342
1343bool MakeActiveAndRelocate::MakeNeighbor() {
1344 const int64_t before_chain = BaseNode(1);
1345 const int64_t chain_end = Next(before_chain);
1346 const int64_t destination = BaseNode(0);
1347 return !IsPathEnd(chain_end) &&
1348 MoveChain(before_chain, chain_end, destination) &&
1349 MakeActive(GetInactiveNode(), destination);
1350}

1352// ----- MakeInactiveOperator -----
1353
1354// MakeInactiveOperator makes path nodes inactive.
1355// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 (where 1 and 4 are first
1356// and last nodes of the path) are:
1357// 1 -> 3 -> 4 & 2 inactive
1358// 1 -> 2 -> 4 & 3 inactive
1359
1360class MakeInactiveOperator : public PathOperator {
1361 public:
1362 MakeInactiveOperator(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1363 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1364 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class)
1365 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 1, true, false,
1366 std::move(start_empty_path_class), nullptr) {}
1367 ~MakeInactiveOperator() override {}
1368 bool MakeNeighbor() override {
1369 const int64_t base = BaseNode(0);
1370 return MakeChainInactive(base, Next(base));
1371 }
1372
1373 std::string DebugString() const override { return "MakeInactiveOperator"; }
1374};
1375
1376// ----- RelocateAndMakeInactiveOperator -----
1377
1378// RelocateAndMakeInactiveOperator relocates a node to a new position and makes
1379// the node which was at that position inactive.
1380// Possible neighbors for paths 0 -> 2 -> 4, 1 -> 3 -> 5 are:
1381// 0 -> 3 -> 4, 1 -> 5 & 2 inactive
1382// 0 -> 4, 1 -> 2 -> 5 & 3 inactive
1383
1384class RelocateAndMakeInactiveOperator : public PathOperator {
1385 public:
1386 RelocateAndMakeInactiveOperator(
1387 const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1388 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1389 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class)
1390 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 2, true, false,
1391 std::move(start_empty_path_class), nullptr) {}
1392 ~RelocateAndMakeInactiveOperator() override {}
1393 bool MakeNeighbor() override {
1394 const int64_t destination = BaseNode(1);
1395 const int64_t before_to_move = BaseNode(0);
1396 const int64_t node_to_inactivate = Next(destination);
1397 if (node_to_inactivate == before_to_move || IsPathEnd(node_to_inactivate) ||
1398 !MakeChainInactive(destination, node_to_inactivate)) {
1399 return false;
1400 }
1401 const int64_t node = Next(before_to_move);
1402 return !IsPathEnd(node) && MoveChain(before_to_move, node, destination);
1403 }
1404
1405 std::string DebugString() const override {
1406 return "RelocateAndMakeInactiveOperator";
1407 }
1408};

1410// ----- MakeChainInactiveOperator -----
1411
1412// Operator which makes a "chain" of path nodes inactive.
1413// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 (where 1 and 4 are first
1414// and last nodes of the path) are:
1415// 1 -> 3 -> 4 with 2 inactive
1416// 1 -> 2 -> 4 with 3 inactive
1417// 1 -> 4 with 2 and 3 inactive
1418
1419class MakeChainInactiveOperator : public PathOperator {
1420 public:
1421 MakeChainInactiveOperator(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1422 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1423 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class)
1424 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 2, true, false,
1425 std::move(start_empty_path_class), nullptr) {}
1426 ~MakeChainInactiveOperator() override {}
1427 bool MakeNeighbor() override {
1428 return MakeChainInactive(BaseNode(0), BaseNode(1));
1429 }
1430
1431 std::string DebugString() const override {
1432 return "MakeChainInactiveOperator";
1433 }
1434
1435 protected:
1436 bool OnSamePathAsPreviousBase(int64_t) override {
1437 // Start and end of chain (defined by both base nodes) must be on the same
1438 // path.
1439 return true;
1440 }
1441
1442 int64_t GetBaseNodeRestartPosition(int base_index) override {
1443 // Base node 1 must be after base node 0.
1444 return (base_index == 0) ? StartNode(base_index) : BaseNode(base_index - 1);
1445 }

1448// ----- SwapActiveOperator -----
1449
1450// SwapActiveOperator replaces an active node by an inactive one.
1451// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 with 5 inactive (where 1 and
1452// 4 are first and last nodes of the path) are:
1453// 1 -> 5 -> 3 -> 4 & 2 inactive
1454// 1 -> 2 -> 5 -> 4 & 3 inactive

1456class SwapActiveOperator : public BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator {
1457 public:
1458 SwapActiveOperator(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,

1469bool SwapActiveOperator::MakeNeighbor() {
1470 const int64_t base = BaseNode(0);
1471 return MakeChainInactive(base, Next(base)) &&
1472 MakeActive(GetInactiveNode(), base);
1473}

1475// ----- ExtendedSwapActiveOperator -----
1476
1477// ExtendedSwapActiveOperator makes an inactive node active and an active one
1478// inactive. It is similar to SwapActiveOperator excepts that it tries to
1479// insert the inactive node in all possible positions instead of just the
1480// position of the node made inactive.
1481// Possible neighbors for the path 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 with 5 inactive (where 1 and
1482// 4 are first and last nodes of the path) are:
1483// 1 -> 5 -> 3 -> 4 & 2 inactive
1484// 1 -> 3 -> 5 -> 4 & 2 inactive
1485// 1 -> 5 -> 2 -> 4 & 3 inactive
1486// 1 -> 2 -> 5 -> 4 & 3 inactive
1487
1488class ExtendedSwapActiveOperator : public BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator {
1489 public:
1490 ExtendedSwapActiveOperator(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1491 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1492 std::function<int(int64_t)> start_empty_path_class)
1493 : BaseInactiveNodeToPathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 2,
1494 std::move(start_empty_path_class)) {}
1495 ~ExtendedSwapActiveOperator() override {}
1496 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1497
1498 std::string DebugString() const override {
1499 return "ExtendedSwapActiveOperator";
1500 }
1501};
1502
1503bool ExtendedSwapActiveOperator::MakeNeighbor() {
1504 const int64_t base0 = BaseNode(0);
1505 const int64_t base1 = BaseNode(1);
1506 if (Next(base0) == base1) {
1507 return false;
1508 }
1509 return MakeChainInactive(base0, Next(base0)) &&
1510 MakeActive(GetInactiveNode(), base1);
1511}
1512
1513// ----- TSP-based operators -----
1514
1515// Sliding TSP operator
1516// Uses an exact dynamic programming algorithm to solve the TSP corresponding
1517// to path sub-chains.
1518// For a subchain 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6, solves the TSP on nodes A, 2, 3,
1519// 4, 5, where A is a merger of nodes 1 and 6 such that cost(A,i) = cost(1,i)
1520// and cost(i,A) = cost(i,6).
1521
1522class TSPOpt : public PathOperator {
1523 public:
1524 TSPOpt(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1525 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1526 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator, int chain_length);
1527 ~TSPOpt() override {}
1528 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1529
1530 std::string DebugString() const override { return "TSPOpt"; }
1531
1532 private:
1533 std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>> cost_;
1534 HamiltonianPathSolver<int64_t, std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>>>
1535 hamiltonian_path_solver_;
1536 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator_;
1537 const int chain_length_;
1538};
1539
1540TSPOpt::TSPOpt(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1541 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1542 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator, int chain_length)
1543 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 1, true, false, nullptr, nullptr),
1544 hamiltonian_path_solver_(cost_),
1545 evaluator_(std::move(evaluator)),
1546 chain_length_(chain_length) {}
1547
1548bool TSPOpt::MakeNeighbor() {
1549 std::vector<int64_t> nodes;
1550 int64_t chain_end = BaseNode(0);
1551 for (int i = 0; i < chain_length_ + 1; ++i) {
1552 nodes.push_back(chain_end);
1553 if (IsPathEnd(chain_end)) {
1554 break;
1555 }
1556 chain_end = Next(chain_end);
1557 }
1558 if (nodes.size() <= 3) {
1559 return false;
1560 }
1561 int64_t chain_path = Path(BaseNode(0));
1562 const int size = nodes.size() - 1;
1563 cost_.resize(size);
1564 for (int i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
1565 cost_[i].resize(size);
1566 cost_[i][0] = evaluator_(nodes[i], nodes[size], chain_path);
1567 for (int j = 1; j < size; ++j) {
1568 cost_[i][j] = evaluator_(nodes[i], nodes[j], chain_path);
1569 }
1570 }
1571 hamiltonian_path_solver_.ChangeCostMatrix(cost_);
1572 std::vector<PathNodeIndex> path;
1573 hamiltonian_path_solver_.TravelingSalesmanPath(&path);
1574 CHECK_EQ(size + 1, path.size());
1575 for (int i = 0; i < size - 1; ++i) {
1576 SetNext(nodes[path[i]], nodes[path[i + 1]], chain_path);
1577 }
1578 SetNext(nodes[path[size - 1]], nodes[size], chain_path);
1579 return true;
1580}
1581
1582// TSP-base lns
1583// Randomly merge consecutive nodes until n "meta"-nodes remain and solve the
1584// corresponding TSP. This can be seen as a large neighborhood search operator
1585// although decisions are taken with the operator.
1586// This is an "unlimited" neighborhood which must be stopped by search limits.
1587// To force diversification, the operator iteratively forces each node to serve
1588// as base of a meta-node.
1589
1590class TSPLns : public PathOperator {
1591 public:
1592 TSPLns(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1593 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1594 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator, int tsp_size);
1595 ~TSPLns() override {}
1596 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1597
1598 std::string DebugString() const override { return "TSPLns"; }
1599
1600 protected:
1601 bool MakeOneNeighbor() override;
1602
1603 private:
1604 void OnNodeInitialization() override {
1605 // NOTE: Avoid any computations if there are no vars added.
1606 has_long_enough_paths_ = Size() != 0;
1607 }
1608
1609 std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>> cost_;
1610 HamiltonianPathSolver<int64_t, std::vector<std::vector<int64_t>>>
1611 hamiltonian_path_solver_;
1612 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator_;
1613 const int tsp_size_;
1614 std::mt19937 rand_;
1615 bool has_long_enough_paths_;
1616};
1617
1618TSPLns::TSPLns(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1619 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1620 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator, int tsp_size)
1621 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 1, true, false, nullptr, nullptr),
1622 hamiltonian_path_solver_(cost_),
1623 evaluator_(std::move(evaluator)),
1624 tsp_size_(tsp_size),
1625 rand_(CpRandomSeed()),
1626 has_long_enough_paths_(true) {
1627 CHECK_GE(tsp_size_, 0);
1628 cost_.resize(tsp_size_);
1629 for (int i = 0; i < tsp_size_; ++i) {
1630 cost_[i].resize(tsp_size_);
1631 }
1632}
1633
1634bool TSPLns::MakeOneNeighbor() {
1635 while (has_long_enough_paths_) {
1636 has_long_enough_paths_ = false;
1637 if (PathOperator::MakeOneNeighbor()) {
1638 return true;
1639 }
1640 Var(0)->solver()->TopPeriodicCheck();
1641 }
1642 return false;
1643}
1644
1645bool TSPLns::MakeNeighbor() {
1646 const int64_t base_node = BaseNode(0);
1647 std::vector<int64_t> nodes;
1648 for (int64_t node = StartNode(0); !IsPathEnd(node); node = Next(node)) {
1649 nodes.push_back(node);
1650 }
1651 if (nodes.size() <= tsp_size_) {
1652 return false;
1653 }
1654 has_long_enough_paths_ = true;
1655 // Randomly select break nodes (final nodes of a meta-node, after which
1656 // an arc is relaxed.
1657 absl::flat_hash_set<int64_t> breaks_set;
1658 // Always add base node to break nodes (diversification)
1659 breaks_set.insert(base_node);
1660 CHECK(!nodes.empty()); // Should have been caught earlier.
1661 while (breaks_set.size() < tsp_size_) {
1662 breaks_set.insert(nodes[absl::Uniform<int>(rand_, 0, nodes.size())]);
1663 }
1664 CHECK_EQ(breaks_set.size(), tsp_size_);
1665 // Setup break node indexing and internal meta-node cost (cost of partial
1666 // route starting at first node of the meta-node and ending at its last node);
1667 // this cost has to be added to the TSP matrix cost in order to respect the
1668 // triangle inequality.
1669 std::vector<int> breaks;
1670 std::vector<int64_t> meta_node_costs;
1671 int64_t cost = 0;
1672 int64_t node = StartNode(0);
1673 int64_t node_path = Path(node);
1674 while (!IsPathEnd(node)) {
1675 int64_t next = Next(node);
1676 if (breaks_set.contains(node)) {
1677 breaks.push_back(node);
1678 meta_node_costs.push_back(cost);
1679 cost = 0;
1680 } else {
1681 cost = CapAdd(cost, evaluator_(node, next, node_path));
1682 }
1683 node = next;
1684 }
1685 meta_node_costs[0] += cost;
1686 CHECK_EQ(breaks.size(), tsp_size_);
1687 // Setup TSP cost matrix
1688 CHECK_EQ(meta_node_costs.size(), tsp_size_);
1689 for (int i = 0; i < tsp_size_; ++i) {
1690 cost_[i][0] =
1691 CapAdd(meta_node_costs[i],
1692 evaluator_(breaks[i], Next(breaks[tsp_size_ - 1]), node_path));
1693 for (int j = 1; j < tsp_size_; ++j) {
1694 cost_[i][j] =
1695 CapAdd(meta_node_costs[i],
1696 evaluator_(breaks[i], Next(breaks[j - 1]), node_path));
1697 }
1698 cost_[i][i] = 0;
1699 }
1700 // Solve TSP and inject solution in delta (only if it leads to a new solution)
1701 hamiltonian_path_solver_.ChangeCostMatrix(cost_);
1702 std::vector<PathNodeIndex> path;
1703 hamiltonian_path_solver_.TravelingSalesmanPath(&path);
1704 bool nochange = true;
1705 for (int i = 0; i < path.size() - 1; ++i) {
1706 if (path[i] != i) {
1707 nochange = false;
1708 break;
1709 }
1710 }
1711 if (nochange) {
1712 return false;
1713 }
1714 CHECK_EQ(0, path[path.size() - 1]);
1715 for (int i = 0; i < tsp_size_ - 1; ++i) {
1716 SetNext(breaks[path[i]], OldNext(breaks[path[i + 1] - 1]), node_path);
1717 }
1718 SetNext(breaks[path[tsp_size_ - 1]], OldNext(breaks[tsp_size_ - 1]),
1719 node_path);
1720 return true;
1721}
1722
1723// ----- Lin Kernighan -----
1724
1725// For each variable in vars, stores the 'size' pairs(i,j) with the smallest
1726// value according to evaluator, where i is the index of the variable in vars
1727// and j is in the domain of the variable.
1728// Note that the resulting pairs are sorted.
1729// Works in O(size) per variable on average (same approach as qsort)
1730
1731class NearestNeighbors {
1732 public:
1733 NearestNeighbors(Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator,
1734 const PathOperator& path_operator, int size);
1735
1736 // This type is neither copyable nor movable.
1737 NearestNeighbors(const NearestNeighbors&) = delete;
1738 NearestNeighbors& operator=(const NearestNeighbors&) = delete;
1739
1740 virtual ~NearestNeighbors() {}
1741 void Initialize();
1742 const std::vector<int>& Neighbors(int index) const;
1743
1744 virtual std::string DebugString() const { return "NearestNeighbors"; }
1745
1746 private:
1747 void ComputeNearest(int row);
1748
1749 std::vector<std::vector<int>> neighbors_;
1750 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator_;
1751 const PathOperator& path_operator_;
1752 const int size_;
1753 bool initialized_;
1754};
1755
1756NearestNeighbors::NearestNeighbors(Solver::IndexEvaluator3 evaluator,
1757 const PathOperator& path_operator, int size)
1758 : evaluator_(std::move(evaluator)),
1759 path_operator_(path_operator),
1760 size_(size),
1761 initialized_(false) {}
1762
1763void NearestNeighbors::Initialize() {
1764 // TODO(user): recompute if node changes path ?
1765 if (!initialized_) {
1766 initialized_ = true;
1767 for (int i = 0; i < path_operator_.number_of_nexts(); ++i) {
1768 neighbors_.push_back(std::vector<int>());
1769 ComputeNearest(i);
1770 }
1771 }
1772}
1773
1774const std::vector<int>& NearestNeighbors::Neighbors(int index) const {
1775 return neighbors_[index];
1776}
1777
1778void NearestNeighbors::ComputeNearest(int row) {
1779 // Find size_ nearest neighbors for row of index 'row'.
1780 const int path = path_operator_.Path(row);
1781 const IntVar* var = path_operator_.Var(row);
1782 const int64_t var_min = var->Min();
1783 const int var_size = var->Max() - var_min + 1;
1784 using ValuedIndex = std::pair<int64_t /*value*/, int /*index*/>;
1785 std::vector<ValuedIndex> neighbors(var_size);
1786 for (int i = 0; i < var_size; ++i) {
1787 const int index = i + var_min;
1788 neighbors[i] = std::make_pair(evaluator_(row, index, path), index);
1789 }
1790 if (var_size > size_) {
1791 std::nth_element(neighbors.begin(), neighbors.begin() + size_ - 1,
1792 neighbors.end());
1793 }
1794
1795 // Setup global neighbor matrix for row row_index
1796 for (int i = 0; i < std::min(size_, var_size); ++i) {
1797 neighbors_[row].push_back(neighbors[i].second);
1798 }
1799 std::sort(neighbors_[row].begin(), neighbors_[row].end());
1800}
1801
1802class LinKernighan : public PathOperator {
1803 public:
1804 LinKernighan(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1805 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1806 const Solver::IndexEvaluator3& evaluator, bool topt);
1807 ~LinKernighan() override;
1808 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1809
1810 std::string DebugString() const override { return "LinKernighan"; }
1811
1812 private:
1813 void OnNodeInitialization() override;
1814
1815 static const int kNeighbors;
1816
1817 bool InFromOut(int64_t in_i, int64_t in_j, int64_t* out, int64_t* gain);
1818
1819 Solver::IndexEvaluator3 const evaluator_;
1820 NearestNeighbors neighbors_;
1821 absl::flat_hash_set<int64_t> marked_;
1822 const bool topt_;
1823};
1824
1825// While the accumulated local gain is positive, perform a 2opt or a 3opt move
1826// followed by a series of 2opt moves. Return a neighbor for which the global
1827// gain is positive.
1828
1829LinKernighan::LinKernighan(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1830 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars,
1831 const Solver::IndexEvaluator3& evaluator, bool topt)
1832 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, 1, true, false, nullptr, nullptr),
1833 evaluator_(evaluator),
1834 neighbors_(evaluator, *this, kNeighbors),
1835 topt_(topt) {}
1836
1837LinKernighan::~LinKernighan() {}
1838
1839void LinKernighan::OnNodeInitialization() { neighbors_.Initialize(); }
1840
1841bool LinKernighan::MakeNeighbor() {
1842 marked_.clear();
1843 int64_t node = BaseNode(0);
1844 int64_t path = Path(node);
1845 int64_t base = node;
1846 int64_t next = Next(node);
1847 if (IsPathEnd(next)) return false;
1848 int64_t out = -1;
1849 int64_t gain = 0;
1850 marked_.insert(node);
1851 if (topt_) { // Try a 3opt first
1852 if (!InFromOut(node, next, &out, &gain)) return false;
1853 marked_.insert(next);
1854 marked_.insert(out);
1855 const int64_t node1 = out;
1856 if (IsPathEnd(node1)) return false;
1857 const int64_t next1 = Next(node1);
1858 if (IsPathEnd(next1)) return false;
1859 if (!InFromOut(node1, next1, &out, &gain)) return false;
1860 marked_.insert(next1);
1861 marked_.insert(out);
1862 if (!CheckChainValidity(out, node1, node) || !MoveChain(out, node1, node)) {
1863 return false;
1864 }
1865 const int64_t next_out = Next(out);
1866 const int64_t in_cost = evaluator_(node, next_out, path);
1867 const int64_t out_cost = evaluator_(out, next_out, path);
1868 if (CapAdd(CapSub(gain, in_cost), out_cost) > 0) return true;
1869 node = out;
1870 if (IsPathEnd(node)) return false;
1871 next = next_out;
1872 if (IsPathEnd(next)) return false;
1873 }
1874 // Try 2opts
1875 while (InFromOut(node, next, &out, &gain)) {
1876 marked_.insert(next);
1877 marked_.insert(out);
1878 int64_t chain_last;
1879 if (!ReverseChain(node, out, &chain_last)) {
1880 return false;
1881 }
1882 int64_t in_cost = evaluator_(base, chain_last, path);
1883 int64_t out_cost = evaluator_(chain_last, out, path);
1884 if (CapAdd(CapSub(gain, in_cost), out_cost) > 0) {
1885 return true;
1886 }
1887 node = chain_last;
1888 if (IsPathEnd(node)) {
1889 return false;
1890 }
1891 next = out;
1892 if (IsPathEnd(next)) {
1893 return false;
1894 }
1895 }
1896 return false;
1897}
1898
1899const int LinKernighan::kNeighbors = 5 + 1;
1900
1901bool LinKernighan::InFromOut(int64_t in_i, int64_t in_j, int64_t* out,
1902 int64_t* gain) {
1903 const std::vector<int>& nexts = neighbors_.Neighbors(in_j);
1904 int64_t best_gain = std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min();
1905 int64_t path = Path(in_i);
1906 int64_t out_cost = evaluator_(in_i, in_j, path);
1907 const int64_t current_gain = CapAdd(*gain, out_cost);
1908 for (int k = 0; k < nexts.size(); ++k) {
1909 const int64_t next = nexts[k];
1910 if (next != in_j) {
1911 int64_t in_cost = evaluator_(in_j, next, path);
1912 int64_t new_gain = CapSub(current_gain, in_cost);
1913 if (new_gain > 0 && next != Next(in_j) && marked_.count(in_j) == 0 &&
1914 marked_.count(next) == 0) {
1915 if (best_gain < new_gain) {
1916 *out = next;
1917 best_gain = new_gain;
1918 }
1919 }
1920 }
1921 }
1922 *gain = best_gain;
1923 return (best_gain > std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min());
1924}
1925
1926// ----- Path-based Large Neighborhood Search -----
1927
1928// Breaks "number_of_chunks" chains of "chunk_size" arcs, and deactivate all
1929// inactive nodes if "unactive_fragments" is true.
1930// As a special case, if chunk_size=0, then we break full paths.
1931
1932class PathLns : public PathOperator {
1933 public:
1934 PathLns(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars,
1935 const std::vector<IntVar*>& secondary_vars, int number_of_chunks,
1936 int chunk_size, bool unactive_fragments)
1937 : PathOperator(vars, secondary_vars, number_of_chunks, true, true,
1938 nullptr, nullptr),
1939 number_of_chunks_(number_of_chunks),
1940 chunk_size_(chunk_size),
1941 unactive_fragments_(unactive_fragments) {
1942 CHECK_GE(chunk_size_, 0);
1943 }
1944 ~PathLns() override {}
1945 bool MakeNeighbor() override;
1946
1947 std::string DebugString() const override { return "PathLns"; }
1948 bool HasFragments() const override { return true; }
1949
1950 private:
1951 inline bool ChainsAreFullPaths() const { return chunk_size_ == 0; }
1952 void DeactivateChain(int64_t node);
1953 void DeactivateUnactives();
1954
1955 const int number_of_chunks_;
1956 const int chunk_size_;
1957 const bool unactive_fragments_;
1958};
1959
1960bool PathLns::MakeNeighbor() {
1961 if (ChainsAreFullPaths()) {
1962 // Reject the current position as a neighbor if any of its base node
1963 // isn't at the start of a path.
1964 // TODO(user): make this more efficient.
1965 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_chunks_; ++i) {
1966 if (BaseNode(i) != StartNode(i)) return false;
1967 }
1968 }
1969 for (int i = 0; i < number_of_chunks_; ++i) {
1970 DeactivateChain(BaseNode(i));
1971 }
1972 DeactivateUnactives();
1973 return true;
1974}
1975
1976void PathLns::DeactivateChain(int64_t node) {
1977 for (int i = 0, current = node;
1978 (ChainsAreFullPaths() || i < chunk_size_) && !IsPathEnd(current);
1979 ++i, current = Next(current)) {
1980 Deactivate(current);
1981 if (!ignore_path_vars_) {
1982 Deactivate(number_of_nexts_ + current);
1983 }
1984 }
1985}
1986
1987void PathLns::DeactivateUnactives() {
1988 if (unactive_fragments_) {
1989 for (int i = 0; i < Size(); ++i) {
1990 if (IsInactive(i)) {
1991 Deactivate(i);
1992 if (!ignore_path_vars_) {
1993 Deactivate(number_of_nexts_ + i);
1994 }
1995 }
1996 }
1997 }
1998}
1999
2000// ----- Limit the number of neighborhoods explored -----
2001
2002class NeighborhoodLimit : public LocalSearchOperator {
2003 public:
2004 NeighborhoodLimit(LocalSearchOperator* const op, int64_t limit)
2005 : operator_(op), limit_(limit), next_neighborhood_calls_(0) {
2006 CHECK(op != nullptr);
2007 CHECK_GT(limit, 0);
2008 }
2009
2010 void Start(const Assignment* assignment) override {
2011 next_neighborhood_calls_ = 0;
2012 operator_->Start(assignment);
2013 }
2014
2015 bool MakeNextNeighbor(Assignment* delta, Assignment* deltadelta) override {
2016 if (next_neighborhood_calls_ >= limit_) {
2017 return false;
2018 }
2019 ++next_neighborhood_calls_;
2020 return operator_->MakeNextNeighbor(delta, deltadelta);
2021 }
2022
2023 bool HoldsDelta() const override { return operator_->HoldsDelta(); }
2024
2025 std::string DebugString() const override { return "NeighborhoodLimit"; }
2026
2027 private:
2028 LocalSearchOperator* const operator_;
2029 const int64_t limit_;
2030 int64_t next_neighborhood_calls_;
2031};
2032
2033LocalSearchOperator* Solver::MakeNeighborhoodLimit(
2034 LocalSearchOperator* const op, int64_t limit) {
2035 return RevAlloc(new NeighborhoodLimit(op, limit));
2036}

2038// ----- Concatenation of operators -----
2039
2040namespace {
2041class CompoundOperator : public LocalSearchOperator {
2042 public:
2043 CompoundOperator(std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*> operators,
2044 std::function<int64_t(int, int)> evaluator);
2045 ~CompoundOperator() override {}
2046 void Reset() override;
2047 void Start(const Assignment* assignment) override;
2048 bool MakeNextNeighbor(Assignment* delta, Assignment* deltadelta) override;
2049 bool HasFragments() const override { return has_fragments_; }
2050 bool HoldsDelta() const override { return true; }
2051
2052 std::string DebugString() const override {
2053 return operators_.empty()
2054 ? ""
2055 : operators_[operator_indices_[index_]]->DebugString();
2056 }
2057 const LocalSearchOperator* Self() const override {
2058 return operators_.empty() ? this
2059 : operators_[operator_indices_[index_]]->Self();
2060 }
2061
2062 private:
2063 class OperatorComparator {
2064 public:
2065 OperatorComparator(std::function<int64_t(int, int)> evaluator,
2066 int active_operator)
2067 : evaluator_(std::move(evaluator)), active_operator_(active_operator) {}
2068 bool operator()(int lhs, int rhs) const {
2069 const int64_t lhs_value = Evaluate(lhs);
2070 const int64_t rhs_value = Evaluate(rhs);
2071 return lhs_value < rhs_value || (lhs_value == rhs_value && lhs < rhs);
2072 }
2073
2074 private:
2075 int64_t Evaluate(int operator_index) const {
2076 return evaluator_(active_operator_, operator_index);
2077 }
2078
2079 std::function<int64_t(int, int)> evaluator_;
2080 const int active_operator_;
2081 };
2082
2083 int64_t index_;
2084 std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*> operators_;
2085 std::vector<int> operator_indices_;
2086 std::function<int64_t(int, int)> evaluator_;
2087 Bitset64<> started_;
2088 const Assignment* start_assignment_;
2089 bool has_fragments_;
2090};
2091
2092CompoundOperator::CompoundOperator(std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*> operators,
2093 std::function<int64_t(int, int)> evaluator)
2094 : index_(0),
2095 operators_(std::move(operators)),
2096 evaluator_(std::move(evaluator)),
2097 started_(operators_.size()),
2098 start_assignment_(nullptr),
2099 has_fragments_(false) {
2100 operators_.erase(std::remove(operators_.begin(), operators_.end(), nullptr),
2101 operators_.end());
2102 operator_indices_.resize(operators_.size());
2103 std::iota(operator_indices_.begin(), operator_indices_.end(), 0);
2104 for (LocalSearchOperator* const op : operators_) {
2105 if (op->HasFragments()) {
2106 has_fragments_ = true;
2107 break;
2108 }
2109 }
2110}
2111
2112void CompoundOperator::Reset() {
2113 for (LocalSearchOperator* const op : operators_) {
2114 op->Reset();
2115 }
2116}
2117
2118void CompoundOperator::Start(const Assignment* assignment) {
2119 start_assignment_ = assignment;
2120 started_.ClearAll();
2121 if (!operators_.empty()) {
2122 OperatorComparator comparator(evaluator_, operator_indices_[index_]);
2123 std::sort(operator_indices_.begin(), operator_indices_.end(), comparator);
2124 index_ = 0;
2125 }
2126}
2127
2128bool CompoundOperator::MakeNextNeighbor(Assignment* delta,
2129 Assignment* deltadelta) {
2130 if (!operators_.empty()) {
2131 do {
2132 // TODO(user): keep copy of delta in case MakeNextNeighbor
2133 // pollutes delta on a fail.
2134 const int64_t operator_index = operator_indices_[index_];
2135 if (!started_[operator_index]) {
2136 operators_[operator_index]->Start(start_assignment_);
2137 started_.Set(operator_index);
2138 }
2139 if (!operators_[operator_index]->HoldsDelta()) {
2140 delta->Clear();
2141 }
2142 if (operators_[operator_index]->MakeNextNeighbor(delta, deltadelta)) {
2143 return true;
2144 }
2145 ++index_;
2146 delta->Clear();
2147 if (index_ == operators_.size()) {
2148 index_ = 0;
2149 }
2150 } while (index_ != 0);
2151 }
2152 return false;
2153}
2154
2155int64_t CompoundOperatorNoRestart(int size, int active_index,
2156 int operator_index) {
2157 return (operator_index < active_index) ? size + operator_index - active_index
2158 : operator_index - active_index;
2159}
2160
2161int64_t CompoundOperatorRestart(int, int) { return 0; }
2162} // namespace
2163
2164LocalSearchOperator* Solver::ConcatenateOperators(
2165 const std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*>& ops) {
2166 return ConcatenateOperators(ops, false);
2167}
2168
2169LocalSearchOperator* Solver::ConcatenateOperators(
2170 const std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*>& ops, bool restart) {
2171 if (restart) {
2172 std::function<int64_t(int, int)> eval = CompoundOperatorRestart;
2173 return ConcatenateOperators(ops, eval);
2174 }
2175 const int size = ops.size();
2176 return ConcatenateOperators(ops, [size](int i, int j) {
2177 return CompoundOperatorNoRestart(size, i, j);
2178 });
2179}
2180
2181LocalSearchOperator* Solver::ConcatenateOperators(
2182 const std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*>& ops,
2183 std::function<int64_t(int, int)> evaluator) {
2184 return RevAlloc(new CompoundOperator(ops, std::move(evaluator)));
2185}

2188class RandomCompoundOperator : public LocalSearchOperator {
2189 public:
2190 explicit RandomCompoundOperator(std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*> operators);
2191 RandomCompoundOperator(std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*> operators,
2192 int32_t seed);
2193 ~RandomCompoundOperator() override {}
2194 void Reset() override;
2195 void Start(const Assignment* assignment) override;
2196 bool MakeNextNeighbor(Assignment* delta, Assignment* deltadelta) override;
2197 bool HoldsDelta() const override { return true; }

2199 std::string DebugString() const override { return "RandomCompoundOperator"; }
2200 // TODO(user): define Self method.
2201

2206};

2217
2218RandomCompoundOperator::RandomCompoundOperator(
2219 std::vector<LocalSearchOperator*> operators, int32_t seed)
2220 : rand_(seed), operators_(std::move(operators)), has_fragments_(false) {
2221 for (LocalSearchOperator* const op : operators_) {

2223 has_fragments_ = true;
2224 break;
2225 }

2231 op->Reset();
2232 }
2233}
2234
2235bool RandomCompoundOperator::MakeNextNeighbor(Assignment* delta,
2236 Assignment* deltadelta) {
2237 const int size = operators_.size();
2238 std::vector<int> indices(size);
2239 std::iota(indices.begin(), indices.end(), 0);
2240 std::shuffle(indices.begin(), indices.end(), rand_);
2241 for (int index : indices) {
2242 if (!operators_[index]->HoldsDelta()) {
2243 delta->Clear();
2244 }
2245 if (operators_[index]->MakeNextNeighbor(delta, deltadelta)) {
2246 return true;
2247 }
2248 delta->Clear();
2249 }
2250 return false;
2251}
