4252
4253std::string Solver::LocalSearchProfile() const {
4254 if (local_search_profiler_ != nullptr) {
4255 return local_search_profiler_->PrintOverview();
4256 }
4257 return "";
4258}
4259
4260LocalSearchStatistics Solver::GetLocalSearchStatistics() const {
4261 if (local_search_profiler_ != nullptr) {
4262 return local_search_profiler_->ExportToLocalSearchStatistics();
4263 }
4264 return LocalSearchStatistics();
4265}
4266
4267void LocalSearchFilterManager::FindIncrementalEventEnd() {
4268 const int num_events = events_.size();
4269 incremental_events_end_ = num_events;
4270 int last_priority = -1;
4271 for (int e = num_events - 1; e >= 0; --e) {
4272 const auto& [filter, event_type, priority] = events_[e];
4273 if (priority != last_priority) {
4274 incremental_events_end_ = e + 1;
4275 last_priority = priority;
4276 }
4277 if (filter->IsIncremental()) break;
4278 }
4279}
4280
4281LocalSearchFilterManager::LocalSearchFilterManager(
4282 std::vector<LocalSearchFilter*> filters)
4283 : synchronized_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()),
4284 accepted_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) {
4285 events_.reserve(2 * filters.size());
4286 int priority = 0;
4287 for (LocalSearchFilter* filter : filters) {
4288 events_.push_back({filter, FilterEventType::kRelax, priority++});
4289 }
4290 for (LocalSearchFilter* filter : filters) {
4291 events_.push_back({filter, FilterEventType::kAccept, priority++});
4292 }
4293 FindIncrementalEventEnd();
4294}
4295
4296LocalSearchFilterManager::LocalSearchFilterManager(
4297 std::vector<FilterEvent> filter_events)
4298 : events_(std::move(filter_events)),
4299 synchronized_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()),
4300 accepted_value_(std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min()) {
4301 std::sort(events_.begin(), events_.end(),
4302 [](const FilterEvent& e1, const FilterEvent& e2) {
4303 return e1.priority < e2.priority;
4304 });
4305 FindIncrementalEventEnd();
4306}
4307
4308// Filters' Revert() must be called in the reverse order in which their
4309// Relax() was called.
4310void LocalSearchFilterManager::Revert() {
4311 for (int e = last_event_called_; e >= 0; --e) {
4312 const auto [filter, event_type, _priority] = events_[e];
4313 if (event_type == FilterEventType::kRelax) filter->Revert();
4314 }
4315 last_event_called_ = -1;
4316}
4317
4318// TODO(user): the behaviour of Accept relies on the initial order of
4319// filters having at most one filter with negative objective values,
4320// this could be fixed by having filters return their general bounds.
4321bool LocalSearchFilterManager::Accept(LocalSearchMonitor* const monitor,
4322 const Assignment* delta,
4323 const Assignment* deltadelta,
4324 int64_t objective_min,
4325 int64_t objective_max) {
4326 Revert();
4327 accepted_value_ = 0;
4328 bool feasible = true;
4329 bool reordered = false;
4330 int events_end = events_.size();
4331 for (int e = 0; e < events_end; ++e) {
4332 last_event_called_ = e;
4333 const auto [filter, event_type, priority] = events_[e];
4334 switch (event_type) {
4335 case FilterEventType::kAccept: {
4336 if (!feasible && !filter->IsIncremental()) continue;
4337 if (monitor != nullptr) monitor->BeginFiltering(filter);
4338 const bool accept = filter->Accept(
4339 delta, deltadelta, CapSub(objective_min, accepted_value_),
4340 CapSub(objective_max, accepted_value_));
4341 feasible &= accept;
4342 if (monitor != nullptr) monitor->EndFiltering(filter, !accept);
4343 if (feasible) {
4344 accepted_value_ =
4345 CapAdd(accepted_value_, filter->GetAcceptedObjectiveValue());
4346 // TODO(user): handle objective min.
4347 feasible = accepted_value_ <= objective_max;
4348 }
4349 if (!feasible) {
4350 events_end = incremental_events_end_;
4351 if (!reordered) {
4352 // Bump up rejected event, together with its kRelax event,
4353 // unless it is already first in its priority layer.
4354 reordered = true;
4355 int to_move = e - 1;
4356 if (to_move >= 0 && events_[to_move].filter == filter) --to_move;
4357 if (to_move >= 0 && events_[to_move].priority == priority) {
4358 std::rotate(events_.begin() + to_move,
4359 events_.begin() + to_move + 1,
4360 events_.begin() + e + 1);
4361 }
4362 }
4363 }
4364 break;
4365 }
4366 case FilterEventType::kRelax: {
4367 filter->Relax(delta, deltadelta);
4368 break;
4369 }
4370 default:
4371 LOG(FATAL) << "Unknown filter event type.";
4372 }
4373 }
4374 return feasible;
4375}
4376
4377void LocalSearchFilterManager::Synchronize(const Assignment* assignment,
4378 const Assignment* delta) {
4379 // If delta is nullptr or empty, then assignment may be a partial solution.
4380 // Send a signal to Relaxing filters to inform them,
4381 // so they can show the partial solution as a change from the empty solution.
4382 const bool reset_to_assignment = delta == nullptr || delta->Empty();
4383 // Relax in the forward direction.
4384 for (auto [filter, event_type, unused_priority] : events_) {
4385 switch (event_type) {
4386 case FilterEventType::kAccept: {
4387 break;
4388 }
4389 case FilterEventType::kRelax: {
4390 if (reset_to_assignment) {
4391 filter->Reset();
4392 filter->Relax(assignment, nullptr);
4393 } else {
4394 filter->Relax(delta, nullptr);
4395 }
4396 break;
4397 }
4398 default:
4399 LOG(FATAL) << "Unknown filter event type.";
4400 }
4401 }
4402 // Synchronize/Commit backwards, so filters can read changes from their
4403 // dependencies before those are synchronized/committed.
4404 synchronized_value_ = 0;
4405 for (auto [filter, event_type, _priority] : ::gtl::reversed_view(events_)) {
4406 switch (event_type) {
4407 case FilterEventType::kAccept: {
4408 filter->Synchronize(assignment, delta);
4409 synchronized_value_ = CapAdd(synchronized_value_,
4410 filter->GetSynchronizedObjectiveValue());
4411 break;
4412 }
4413 case FilterEventType::kRelax: {
4414 filter->Commit(assignment, delta);
4415 break;
4416 }
4417 default:
4418 LOG(FATAL) << "Unknown filter event type.";
4419 }
4420 }
4421}
4422
4423// ----- Finds a neighbor of the assignment passed -----
4424
4425class FindOneNeighbor : public DecisionBuilder {
4426 public:
4427 FindOneNeighbor(Assignment* assignment, IntVar* objective, SolutionPool* pool,
4428 LocalSearchOperator* ls_operator,
4429 DecisionBuilder* sub_decision_builder,
4430 const RegularLimit* limit,
4431 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4432 ~FindOneNeighbor() override {}
4433 Decision* Next(Solver* solver) override;
4434 std::string DebugString() const override { return "FindOneNeighbor"; }
4435
4436 private:
4437 bool FilterAccept(Solver* solver, Assignment* delta, Assignment* deltadelta,
4438 int64_t objective_min, int64_t objective_max);
4439 void SynchronizeAll(Solver* solver);
4440
4441 Assignment* const assignment_;
4442 IntVar* const objective_;
4443 std::unique_ptr<Assignment> reference_assignment_;
4444 std::unique_ptr<Assignment> last_synchronized_assignment_;
4445 Assignment* const filter_assignment_delta_;
4446 SolutionPool* const pool_;
4447 LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator_;
4448 DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder_;
4449 RegularLimit* limit_;
4450 const RegularLimit* const original_limit_;
4451 bool neighbor_found_;
4452 LocalSearchFilterManager* const filter_manager_;
4453 int64_t solutions_since_last_check_;
4454 int64_t check_period_;
4455 Assignment last_checked_assignment_;
4456 bool has_checked_assignment_ = false;
4457};
4458
4459// reference_assignment_ is used to keep track of the last assignment on which
4460// operators were started, assignment_ corresponding to the last successful
4461// neighbor.
4462// last_synchronized_assignment_ keeps track of the last assignment on which
4463// filters were synchronized and is used to compute the filter_assignment_delta_
4464// when synchronizing again.
4465FindOneNeighbor::FindOneNeighbor(Assignment* const assignment,
4466 IntVar* objective, SolutionPool* const pool,
4467 LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4468 DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,
4469 const RegularLimit* const limit,
4470 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager)
4471 : assignment_(assignment),
4472 objective_(objective),
4473 reference_assignment_(new Assignment(assignment_)),
4474 filter_assignment_delta_(assignment->solver()->MakeAssignment()),
4475 pool_(pool),
4476 ls_operator_(ls_operator),
4477 sub_decision_builder_(sub_decision_builder),
4478 limit_(nullptr),
4479 original_limit_(limit),
4480 neighbor_found_(false),
4481 filter_manager_(filter_manager),
4482 solutions_since_last_check_(0),
4483 check_period_(
4484 assignment_->solver()->parameters().check_solution_period()),
4485 last_checked_assignment_(assignment) {
4486 CHECK(nullptr != assignment);
4487 CHECK(nullptr != ls_operator);
4488
4489 Solver* const solver = assignment_->solver();
4490 // If limit is nullptr, default limit is 1 solution
4491 if (nullptr == limit) {
4492 limit_ = solver->MakeSolutionsLimit(1);
4493 } else {
4494 limit_ = limit->MakeIdenticalClone();
4495 // TODO(user): Support skipping neighborhood checks for limits accepting
4496 // more than one solution (e.g. best accept). For now re-enabling systematic
4497 // checks.
4498 if (limit_->solutions() != 1) {
4499 VLOG(1) << "Disabling neighbor-check skipping outside of first accept.";
4500 check_period_ = 1;
4501 }
4502 }
4503 // TODO(user): Support skipping neighborhood checks with LNS (at least on
4504 // the non-LNS operators).
4505 if (ls_operator->HasFragments()) {
4506 VLOG(1) << "Disabling neighbor-check skipping for LNS.";
4507 check_period_ = 1;
4508 }
4509
4510 if (!reference_assignment_->HasObjective()) {
4511 reference_assignment_->AddObjective(objective_);
4512 }
4513}
4514
4515Decision* FindOneNeighbor::Next(Solver* const solver) {
4516 CHECK(nullptr != solver);
4517
4518 if (original_limit_ != nullptr) {
4519 limit_->Copy(original_limit_);
4520 }
4521
4522 if (!last_checked_assignment_.HasObjective()) {
4523 last_checked_assignment_.AddObjective(assignment_->Objective());
4524 }
4525
4526 if (!neighbor_found_) {
4527 // Only called on the first call to Next(), reference_assignment_ has not
4528 // been synced with assignment_ yet
4529
4530 // Keeping the code in case a performance problem forces us to
4531 // use the old code with a zero test on pool_.
4532 // reference_assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4533 pool_->Initialize(assignment_);
4534 SynchronizeAll(solver);
4535 }
4536
4537 {
4538 // Another assignment is needed to apply the delta
4539 Assignment* assignment_copy =
4540 solver->MakeAssignment(reference_assignment_.get());
4541 int counter = 0;
4542
4543 DecisionBuilder* restore = solver->MakeRestoreAssignment(assignment_copy);
4544 if (sub_decision_builder_) {
4545 restore = solver->Compose(restore, sub_decision_builder_);
4546 }
4547 Assignment* delta = solver->MakeAssignment();
4548 Assignment* deltadelta = solver->MakeAssignment();
4549 while (true) {
4550 if (!ls_operator_->HoldsDelta()) {
4551 delta->Clear();
4552 }
4553 delta->ClearObjective();
4554 deltadelta->Clear();
4555 solver->TopPeriodicCheck();
4556 if (++counter >= absl::GetFlag(FLAGS_cp_local_search_sync_frequency) &&
4557 pool_->SyncNeeded(reference_assignment_.get())) {
4558 // TODO(user) : SyncNeed(assignment_) ?
4559 counter = 0;
4560 SynchronizeAll(solver);
4561 }
4562
4563 bool has_neighbor = false;
4564 if (!limit_->Check()) {
4565 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginMakeNextNeighbor(ls_operator_);
4566 has_neighbor = ls_operator_->MakeNextNeighbor(delta, deltadelta);
4567 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndMakeNextNeighbor(
4568 ls_operator_, has_neighbor, delta, deltadelta);
4569 }
4570
4571 if (has_neighbor && !solver->IsUncheckedSolutionLimitReached()) {
4572 solver->neighbors_ += 1;
4573 // All filters must be called for incrementality reasons.
4574 // Empty deltas must also be sent to incremental filters; can be needed
4575 // to resync filters on non-incremental (empty) moves.
4576 // TODO(user): Don't call both if no filter is incremental and one
4577 // of them returned false.
4578 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginFilterNeighbor(ls_operator_);
4579 const bool mh_filter =
4580 AcceptDelta(solver->ParentSearch(), delta, deltadelta);
4581 int64_t objective_min = std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min();
4582 int64_t objective_max = std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max();
4583 if (objective_) {
4584 objective_min = objective_->Min();
4585 objective_max = objective_->Max();
4586 }
4587 if (delta->HasObjective() && delta->Objective() == objective_) {
4588 objective_min = std::max(objective_min, delta->ObjectiveMin());
4589 objective_max = std::min(objective_max, delta->ObjectiveMax());
4590 }
4591 const bool move_filter = FilterAccept(solver, delta, deltadelta,
4592 objective_min, objective_max);
4593 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndFilterNeighbor(
4594 ls_operator_, mh_filter && move_filter);
4595 if (!mh_filter || !move_filter) {
4596 if (filter_manager_ != nullptr) filter_manager_->Revert();
4597 continue;
4598 }
4599 solver->filtered_neighbors_ += 1;
4600 if (delta->HasObjective()) {
4601 if (!assignment_copy->HasObjective()) {
4602 assignment_copy->AddObjective(delta->Objective());
4603 }
4604 if (!assignment_->HasObjective()) {
4605 assignment_->AddObjective(delta->Objective());
4606 last_checked_assignment_.AddObjective(delta->Objective());
4607 }
4608 }
4609 assignment_copy->CopyIntersection(reference_assignment_.get());
4610 assignment_copy->CopyIntersection(delta);
4611 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginAcceptNeighbor(ls_operator_);
4612 const bool check_solution = (solutions_since_last_check_ == 0) ||
4613 !solver->UseFastLocalSearch() ||
4614 // LNS deltas need to be restored
4615 !delta->AreAllElementsBound();
4616 if (has_checked_assignment_) solutions_since_last_check_++;
4617 if (solutions_since_last_check_ >= check_period_) {
4618 solutions_since_last_check_ = 0;
4619 }
4620 const bool accept = !check_solution || solver->SolveAndCommit(restore);
4621 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndAcceptNeighbor(ls_operator_,
4622 accept);
4623 if (accept) {
4624 solver->accepted_neighbors_ += 1;
4625 if (check_solution) {
4626 solver->SetSearchContext(solver->ParentSearch(),
4627 ls_operator_->DebugString());
4628 assignment_->Store();
4629 last_checked_assignment_.CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4630 neighbor_found_ = true;
4631 has_checked_assignment_ = true;
4632 return nullptr;
4633 }
4634 solver->SetSearchContext(solver->ActiveSearch(),
4635 ls_operator_->DebugString());
4636 assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment_copy);
4637 assignment_->SetObjectiveValue(
4638 filter_manager_ ? filter_manager_->GetAcceptedObjectiveValue()
4639 : 0);
4640 // Advancing local search to the current solution without
4641 // checking.
4642 // TODO(user): support the case were limit_ accepts more than
4643 // one solution (e.g. best accept).
4644 AcceptUncheckedNeighbor(solver->ParentSearch());
4645 solver->IncrementUncheckedSolutionCounter();
4646 pool_->RegisterNewSolution(assignment_);
4647 SynchronizeAll(solver);
4648 // NOTE: SynchronizeAll() sets neighbor_found_ to false, force it
4649 // back to true when skipping checks.
4650 neighbor_found_ = true;
4651 } else {
4652 if (filter_manager_ != nullptr) filter_manager_->Revert();
4653 if (check_period_ > 1 && has_checked_assignment_) {
4654 // Filtering is not perfect, disabling fast local search and
4655 // resynchronizing with the last checked solution.
4656 // TODO(user): Restore state of local search operators to
4657 // make sure we are exploring neighbors in the same order. This can
4658 // affect the local optimum found.
4659 VLOG(1) << "Imperfect filtering detected, backtracking to last "
4660 "checked solution and checking all solutions.";
4661 check_period_ = 1;
4662 solutions_since_last_check_ = 0;
4663 pool_->RegisterNewSolution(&last_checked_assignment_);
4664 SynchronizeAll(solver);
4665 assignment_->CopyIntersection(&last_checked_assignment_);
4666 }
4667 }
4668 } else {
4669 if (neighbor_found_) {
4670 // In case the last checked assignment isn't the current one, restore
4671 // it to make sure the solver knows about it, especially if this is
4672 // the end of the search.
4673 // TODO(user): Compare assignments in addition to their cost.
4674 if (last_checked_assignment_.ObjectiveValue() !=
4675 assignment_->ObjectiveValue()) {
4676 // If restoring fails this means filtering is not perfect and the
4677 // solver will consider the last checked assignment.
4678 assignment_copy->CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4679 if (!solver->SolveAndCommit(restore)) solver->Fail();
4680 last_checked_assignment_.CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4681 has_checked_assignment_ = true;
4682 return nullptr;
4683 }
4684 AcceptNeighbor(solver->ParentSearch());
4685 // Keeping the code in case a performance problem forces us to
4686 // use the old code with a zero test on pool_.
4687 // reference_assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment_);
4688 pool_->RegisterNewSolution(assignment_);
4689 SynchronizeAll(solver);
4690 } else {
4691 break;
4692 }
4693 }
4694 }
4695 }
4696 solver->Fail();
4697 return nullptr;
4698}
4699
4700bool FindOneNeighbor::FilterAccept(Solver* solver, Assignment* delta,
4701 Assignment* deltadelta,
4702 int64_t objective_min,
4703 int64_t objective_max) {
4704 if (filter_manager_ == nullptr) return true;
4705 LocalSearchMonitor* const monitor = solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor();
4706 return filter_manager_->Accept(monitor, delta, deltadelta, objective_min,
4707 objective_max);
4708}
4709
4710namespace {
4711
4712template <typename Container>
4713void AddDeltaElements(const Container& old_container,
4714 const Container& new_container, Assignment* delta) {
4715 for (const auto& new_element : new_container.elements()) {
4716 const auto var = new_element.Var();
4717 const auto old_element_ptr = old_container.ElementPtrOrNull(var);
4718 if (old_element_ptr == nullptr || *old_element_ptr != new_element) {
4719 delta->FastAdd(var)->Copy(new_element);
4720 }
4721 }
4722}
4723
4724void MakeDelta(const Assignment* old_assignment,
4725 const Assignment* new_assignment, Assignment* delta) {
4726 DCHECK_NE(delta, nullptr);
4727 delta->Clear();
4728 AddDeltaElements(old_assignment->IntVarContainer(),
4729 new_assignment->IntVarContainer(), delta);
4730 AddDeltaElements(old_assignment->IntervalVarContainer(),
4731 new_assignment->IntervalVarContainer(), delta);
4732 AddDeltaElements(old_assignment->SequenceVarContainer(),
4733 new_assignment->SequenceVarContainer(), delta);
4734}
4735} // namespace
4736
4737void FindOneNeighbor::SynchronizeAll(Solver* solver) {
4738 Assignment* const reference_assignment = reference_assignment_.get();
4739 pool_->GetNextSolution(reference_assignment);
4740 neighbor_found_ = false;
4741 limit_->Init();
4742 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->BeginOperatorStart();
4743 ls_operator_->Start(reference_assignment);
4744 if (filter_manager_ != nullptr) {
4745 Assignment* delta = nullptr;
4746 if (last_synchronized_assignment_ == nullptr) {
4747 last_synchronized_assignment_ =
4748 std::make_unique<Assignment>(reference_assignment);
4749 } else {
4750 MakeDelta(last_synchronized_assignment_.get(), reference_assignment,
4751 filter_assignment_delta_);
4752 delta = filter_assignment_delta_;
4753 last_synchronized_assignment_->Copy(reference_assignment);
4754 }
4755 filter_manager_->Synchronize(reference_assignment_.get(), delta);
4756 }
4757 solver->GetLocalSearchMonitor()->EndOperatorStart();
4758}

4850// ----- NestedSolve decision wrapper -----
4851
4852// This decision calls a nested Solve on the given DecisionBuilder in its
4853// left branch; does nothing in the left branch.
4854// The state of the decision corresponds to the result of the nested Solve:
4855// DECISION_PENDING - Nested Solve not called yet
4856// DECISION_FAILED - Nested Solve failed
4857// DECISION_FOUND - Nested Solve succeeded
4858
4859class NestedSolveDecision : public Decision {
4860 public:
4861 // This enum is used internally to tag states in the local search tree.
4862 enum StateType { DECISION_PENDING, DECISION_FAILED, DECISION_FOUND };
4863
4864 NestedSolveDecision(DecisionBuilder* db, bool restore,
4865 const std::vector<SearchMonitor*>& monitors);
4866 NestedSolveDecision(DecisionBuilder* db, bool restore);
4867 ~NestedSolveDecision() override {}
4868 void Apply(Solver* solver) override;
4869 void Refute(Solver* solver) override;
4870 std::string DebugString() const override { return "NestedSolveDecision"; }
4871 int state() const { return state_; }
4872
4873 private:
4874 DecisionBuilder* const db_;
4875 bool restore_;
4876 std::vector<SearchMonitor*> monitors_;
4877 int state_;
4878};
4879
4880NestedSolveDecision::NestedSolveDecision(
4881 DecisionBuilder* const db, bool restore,
4882 const std::vector<SearchMonitor*>& monitors)
4883 : db_(db),
4884 restore_(restore),
4885 monitors_(monitors),
4886 state_(DECISION_PENDING) {
4887 CHECK(nullptr != db);
4888}
4889
4890NestedSolveDecision::NestedSolveDecision(DecisionBuilder* const db,
4891 bool restore)
4892 : db_(db), restore_(restore), state_(DECISION_PENDING) {
4893 CHECK(nullptr != db);
4894}
4895
4896void NestedSolveDecision::Apply(Solver* const solver) {
4897 CHECK(nullptr != solver);
4898 if (restore_) {
4899 if (solver->Solve(db_, monitors_)) {
4900 solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FOUND));
4901 } else {
4902 solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FAILED));
4903 }
4904 } else {
4905 if (solver->SolveAndCommit(db_, monitors_)) {
4906 solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FOUND));
4907 } else {
4908 solver->SaveAndSetValue(&state_, static_cast<int>(DECISION_FAILED));
4909 }
4910 }
4911}
4912
4913void NestedSolveDecision::Refute(Solver* const) {}
4914} // namespace

4916// ----- Local search decision builder -----
4917
4918// Given a first solution (resulting from either an initial assignment or the
4919// result of a decision builder), it searches for neighbors using a local
4920// search operator. The first solution corresponds to the first leaf of the
4921// search.
4922// The local search applies to the variables contained either in the assignment
4923// or the vector of variables passed.
4924
4925class LocalSearch : public DecisionBuilder {
4926 public:
4927 LocalSearch(Assignment* assignment, IntVar* objective, SolutionPool* pool,
4928 LocalSearchOperator* ls_operator,
4929 DecisionBuilder* sub_decision_builder, RegularLimit* limit,
4930 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4931 // TODO(user): find a way to not have to pass vars here: redundant with
4932 // variables in operators
4933 LocalSearch(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars, IntVar* objective,
4934 SolutionPool* pool, DecisionBuilder* first_solution,
4935 LocalSearchOperator* ls_operator,
4936 DecisionBuilder* sub_decision_builder, RegularLimit* limit,
4937 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4938 LocalSearch(const std::vector<IntVar*>& vars, IntVar* objective,
4939 SolutionPool* pool, DecisionBuilder* first_solution,
4940 DecisionBuilder* first_solution_sub_decision_builder,
4941 LocalSearchOperator* ls_operator,
4942 DecisionBuilder* sub_decision_builder, RegularLimit* limit,
4943 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4944 LocalSearch(const std::vector<SequenceVar*>& vars, IntVar* objective,
4945 SolutionPool* pool, DecisionBuilder* first_solution,
4946 LocalSearchOperator* ls_operator,
4947 DecisionBuilder* sub_decision_builder, RegularLimit* limit,
4948 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager);
4949 ~LocalSearch() override;
4950 Decision* Next(Solver* solver) override;
4951 std::string DebugString() const override { return "LocalSearch"; }
4952 void Accept(ModelVisitor* visitor) const override;
4953
4954 protected:
4955 void PushFirstSolutionDecision(DecisionBuilder* first_solution);
4956 void PushLocalSearchDecision();
4957
4958 private:
4959 Assignment* assignment_;
4960 IntVar* const objective_ = nullptr;
4961 SolutionPool* const pool_;
4962 LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator_;
4963 DecisionBuilder* const first_solution_sub_decision_builder_;
4964 DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder_;
4965 std::vector<NestedSolveDecision*> nested_decisions_;
4966 int nested_decision_index_;
4967 RegularLimit* const limit_;
4968 LocalSearchFilterManager* const filter_manager_;
4969 bool has_started_;
4970};
4971
4972LocalSearch::LocalSearch(Assignment* const assignment, IntVar* objective,
4973 SolutionPool* const pool,
4974 LocalSearchOperator* const ls_operator,
4975 DecisionBuilder* const sub_decision_builder,
4976 RegularLimit* const limit,
4977 LocalSearchFilterManager* filter_manager)
4978 : assignment_(nullptr),
4979 objective_(objective),
4980 pool_(pool),
4981 ls_operator_(ls_operator),
4982 first_solution_sub_decision_builder_(sub_decision_builder),
4983 sub_decision_builder_(sub_decision_builder),
4984 nested_decision_index_(0),
4985 limit_(limit),
4986 filter_manager_(filter_manager),
4987 has_started_(false) {
4988 CHECK(nullptr != assignment);
4989 CHECK(nullptr != ls_operator);
4990 Solver* const solver = assignment->solver();
4991 assignment_ = solver->GetOrCreateLocalSearchState();
4992 assignment_->Copy(assignment);
4993 DecisionBuilder* restore = solver->MakeRestoreAssignment(assignment);
4994 PushFirstSolutionDecision(restore);
4995 PushLocalSearchDecision();
4996}

5081// Model Visitor support.
5082void LocalSearch::Accept(ModelVisitor* const visitor) const {
5083 DCHECK(assignment_ != nullptr);
5084 visitor->BeginVisitExtension(ModelVisitor::kVariableGroupExtension);
5085 // We collect decision variables from the assignment.
5086 const std::vector<IntVarElement>& elements =
5087 assignment_->IntVarContainer().elements();
5088 if (!elements.empty()) {
5089 std::vector<IntVar*> vars;
5090 for (const IntVarElement& elem : elements) {
5091 vars.push_back(elem.Var());
5092 }
5093 visitor->VisitIntegerVariableArrayArgument(ModelVisitor::kVarsArgument,
5094 vars);
5095 }
5096 const std::vector<IntervalVarElement>& interval_elements =
5097 assignment_->IntervalVarContainer().elements();
5098 if (!interval_elements.empty()) {
5099 std::vector<IntervalVar*> interval_vars;
5100 for (const IntervalVarElement& elem : interval_elements) {
5101 interval_vars.push_back(elem.Var());
5102 }
5103 visitor->VisitIntervalArrayArgument(ModelVisitor::kIntervalsArgument,
5104 interval_vars);
5105 }
5106 visitor->EndVisitExtension(ModelVisitor::kVariableGroupExtension);
5107}
5108
5109// This is equivalent to a multi-restart decision builder
5110// TODO(user): abstract this from the local search part
5111// TODO(user): handle the case where the tree depth is not enough to hold
5112// all solutions.
5113
5114Decision* LocalSearch::Next(Solver* const solver) {
5115 CHECK(nullptr != solver);
5116 CHECK_LT(0, nested_decisions_.size());
5117 if (!has_started_) {
5118 nested_decision_index_ = 0;
5119 solver->SaveAndSetValue(&has_started_, true);
5120 } else if (nested_decision_index_ < 0) {
5121 solver->Fail();
5122 }
5123 NestedSolveDecision* decision = nested_decisions_[nested_decision_index_];
5124 const int state = decision->state();
5125 switch (state) {
5126 case NestedSolveDecision::DECISION_FAILED: {
5127 // A local optimum has been reached. The search will continue only if we
5128 // accept up-hill moves (due to metaheuristics). In this case we need to
5129 // reset neighborhood optimal routes.
5130 ls_operator_->Reset();
5131 if (!LocalOptimumReached(solver->ActiveSearch()) ||
5132 solver->IsUncheckedSolutionLimitReached()) {
5133 nested_decision_index_ = -1; // Stop the search
5134 }
5135 solver->Fail();
5136 return nullptr;
5137 }
5138 case NestedSolveDecision::DECISION_PENDING: {
5139 // TODO(user): Find a way to make this balancing invisible to the
5140 // user (no increase in branch or fail counts for instance).
5141 const int32_t kLocalSearchBalancedTreeDepth = 32;
5142 const int depth = solver->SearchDepth();
5143 if (depth < kLocalSearchBalancedTreeDepth) {
5144 return solver->balancing_decision();
5145 }
5146 if (depth > kLocalSearchBalancedTreeDepth) {
5147 solver->Fail();
5148 }
5149 return decision;
5150 }
5151 case NestedSolveDecision::DECISION_FOUND: {
5152 // Next time go to next decision
5153 if (nested_decision_index_ + 1 < nested_decisions_.size()) {
5154 ++nested_decision_index_;
5155 }
5156 return nullptr;
5157 }
5158 default: {
5159 LOG(ERROR) << "Unknown local search state";
5160 return nullptr;
5161 }
5162 }
5163 return nullptr;
5164}
5165
5166void LocalSearch::PushFirstSolutionDecision(DecisionBuilder* first_solution) {
5167 CHECK(first_solution);
5168 Solver* const solver = assignment_->solver();
5169 DecisionBuilder* store = solver->MakeStoreAssignment(assignment_);
5170 DecisionBuilder* first_solution_and_store = solver->Compose(
5171 solver->MakeProfiledDecisionBuilderWrapper(first_solution),
5172 first_solution_sub_decision_builder_, store);
5173 std::vector<SearchMonitor*> monitor;
5174 monitor.push_back(limit_);
5175 nested_decisions_.push_back(solver->RevAlloc(
5176 new NestedSolveDecision(first_solution_and_store, false, monitor)));
5177}
5178
5179void LocalSearch::PushLocalSearchDecision() {
5180 Solver* const solver = assignment_->solver();
5181 DecisionBuilder* find_neighbors = solver->RevAlloc(
5182 new FindOneNeighbor(assignment_, objective_, pool_, ls_operator_,
5183 sub_decision_builder_, limit_, filter_manager_));
5184 nested_decisions_.push_back(
5185 solver->RevAlloc(new NestedSolveDecision(find_neighbors, false)));
5186}

5188class DefaultSolutionPool : public SolutionPool {
5189 public:

5191
5192 ~DefaultSolutionPool() override {}
5193
5194 void Initialize(Assignment* const assignment) override {
5195 reference_assignment_ = std::make_unique<Assignment>(assignment);
5196 }
5197
5198 void RegisterNewSolution(Assignment* const assignment) override {
5199 reference_assignment_->CopyIntersection(assignment);
5200 }
5201

5203 assignment->CopyIntersection(reference_assignment_.get());
5204 }
5205
5206 bool SyncNeeded(Assignment* const) override { return false; }
5207
5208 std::string DebugString() const override { return "DefaultSolutionPool"; }
5209
5210 private:
5211 std::unique_ptr<Assignment> reference_assignment_;
5212};
